verses.text: After the death of Moses, the Lord spoke to Joshua the son of Nun, the assistant of Moses, saying, “Moses my servant is dead.
parts: After the death of Moses, the Lord spoke to Joshua the son of Nun, the assistant of Moses, saying,
“Moses my servant is dead.

verses.text: Every place on which you tread with your feet, I will give it to you, as I said to Moses.
parts: Every place on which you tread with your feet, I will give it to you, as I said to Moses.

verses.text: Your territories shall be the desert and Lebanon as far as the great river, the Euphrates River; and from the setting of the sun to the farthest sea.
parts: Your territories shall be the desert and Lebanon as far as the great river, the Euphrates River; and from the setting of the sun to the farthest sea.

verses.text: No man shall be able to oppose you all the days of your life, and as I was with Moses, thus I will be also with you.
parts: No man shall be able to oppose you all the days of your life, and as I was with Moses, thus I will be also with you.

verses.text: “Be strong and courageous, for you will divide this land which I swore to your fathers to give them. Be strong, therefore, and courageous to guard yourself and to do as Moses My servant commanded you; then you will not turn away from them, to the right nor to the left.
parts: “Be strong and courageous, for you will divide this land which I swore to your fathers to give them.
Be strong, therefore, and courageous to guard yourself and to do as Moses My servant commanded you; then you will not turn away from them, to the right nor to the left.

verses.text: The book of this law shall not depart from your mouth, and you shall meditate in it day and night, that you may have the understanding to do all the things written therein.

verses.text: Behold, I have commanded you.
parts: Behold, I have commanded you.

verses.text: Then Joshua commanded the scribes of the people, saying, “Enter the midst of the people's camp and command the people, saying, ‘Prepare the supply of food, for yet three days you shall cross this Jordan and enter the land to possess what the Lord God of your fathers will give you.’ ” Then to Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, Joshua said, “Remember the word of the Lord which Moses the servant of the Lord commanded you, saying, ‘The Lord your God has caused you to rest and has given you this land.’ Your wives, your children and your cattle shall dwell in the land He has given you; but you shall cross over well-armed before your brethren, everyone who is strong, and you shall fight by their side; until the Lord your God has caused your brethren to rest, and you as well, and they have taken possession of the land which the Lord your God has given them.

verses.text: We will heed you as we heeded Moses; only let the Lord our God be with you as He was with Moses.

verses.text: After this, Joshua the son of Nun sent out two young men from Acacia Grove to spy out the land, saying, “Go and see the land and Jericho.” So the two young men went and entered Jericho; and they went into the house of a harlot named Rahab and lodged there. This was reported to the king of Jericho, saying, “Behold, men from the sons of Israel have come to spy on the land.” So the king of Jericho sent and spoke to Rahab, saying, “Bring out the men who came into your house last night; for they are here to spy on the land.”
parts: After this, Joshua the son of Nun sent out two young men from Acacia Grove to spy out the land, saying, “Go and see the land and Jericho.” So the two young men went and entered Jericho; and they went into the house of a harlot named Rahab and lodged there.

This was reported to the king of Jericho, saying, “Behold, men from the sons of Israel have come to spy on the land.” So the king of Jericho sent and spoke to Rahab, saying, “Bring out the men who came into your house last night; for they are here to spy on the land.”

verses.text: So when we heard it, we were amazed in our heart, and there was no longer any spirit in any of us because of your presence, for your God is in heaven above and on earth below.

parts: Then the men said to her, “Our life for your life, even to death.” She then said, “When the Lord shall deliver the city to you, deal with me in mercy and truth.” After this, she let them down through the window and said to them, “Go away to the hill country, lest the pursuers happen to find you.

verses.text: Then Joshua rose early in the morning and departed from Acacia Grove; and he came to the Jordan and lodged there before crossing over. After three days, it came to pass that the scribes went through the camp and commanded the people, saying, “When you see the ark of the covenant of the Lord our God, and our priests and Levites who carry it, then you shall depart from your places; and you shall go after it; but there shall be a distance between you and it.

but there shall be a distance between you and it.

verses.text: The chief captain of the Lord said to Joshua, “Loose the shoe from your feet; for the place on which you stand is holy.”
parts: The chief captain of the Lord said to Joshua, “Loose the shoe from your feet; for the place on which you stand is holy.”

verses.text: Jericho was enclosed and fortified, and no one went out of or into it.
parts: Jericho was enclosed and fortified, and no one went out of or into it.

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Joshua, “Behold, I will deliver Jericho into your hand, its king and its army of soldiers who are mighty.
parts: Then the Lord said to Joshua, “Behold, I will deliver Jericho into your hand, its king and its army of soldiers who are mighty.

verses.text: But place your soldiers around it,
parts: But place your soldiers around it,

verses.text: and it shall come to pass that when you sound with the trumpet, let all the people shout together, and when they shout, the walls of the city shall fall by themselves; and all the people will enter, each rushing throughout the entire area of the city.”
parts: and it shall come to pass that when you sound with the trumpet, let all the people shout together, and when they shout, the walls of the city shall fall by themselves; and all the people will enter, each rushing throughout the entire area of the city.”

verses.text: So Joshua the son of Nun went to the priests and he spoke to them, saying, “Command the people to go around and surround the city, and let the men of war pass on armed before the Lord.
parts: So Joshua the son of Nun went to the priests
and he spoke to them, saying, “Command the people to go around and surround the city, and let the men of war pass on armed before the Lord.

parts: and he spoke to them, saying, “Command the people to go around and surround the city, and let the men of war pass on armed before the Lord.

verses.text: Let seven priests holding seven holy trumpets likewise pass by before the Lord, and let them signal vigorously; and let the ark of the covenant of the Lord follow after them.
parts: Let seven priests holding seven holy trumpets likewise pass by before the Lord, and let them signal vigorously; and let the ark of the covenant of the Lord follow after them.

verses.text: Now Joshua gave a command to the people, saying, “Do not shout, nor let anyone hear your voice, until the day I myself tell you to shout, and then shout.” So when the ark of the covenant of God went around the city, it immediately returned into the camp and lodged there.

parts: Then on the second day, Joshua rose early in the morning, and the priests took up the ark of the covenant of the Lord.

verses.text: Seven priests carried seven trumpets and went on before the Lord.
parts: Seven priests carried seven trumpets and went on before the Lord.

verses.text: then again went back to the camp.
parts: then again went back to the camp.

verses.text: On the seventh day, they rose early in the morning and went around the city six times. Then it came to pass that as they marched around the seventh time, the priests blew the trumpets, and Joshua said to the sons of Israel, “Shout, for indeed the Lord has handed over the city to you.
parts: On the seventh day, they rose early in the morning and went around the city six times.
Then it came to pass that as they marched around the seventh time, the priests blew the trumpets, and Joshua said to the sons of Israel, “Shout, for indeed the Lord has handed over the city to you.

parts: Then it came to pass that as they marched around the seventh time, the priests blew the trumpets, and Joshua said to the sons of Israel, “Shout, for indeed the Lord has handed over the city to you.

verses.text: For the city shall be accursed by the Lord, it and whatever is in it.
parts: For the city shall be accursed by the Lord, it and whatever is in it.

verses.text: But be very careful to keep yourself from what is accursed, lest you yourself consider to take from it what is accursed, and then you shall make the camp of the children of Israel a curse and destroy us.
parts: But be very careful to keep yourself from what is accursed, lest you yourself consider to take from it what is accursed, and then you shall make the camp of the children of Israel a curse and destroy us.

verses.text: But all the silver, the gold, the bronze or the iron shall be holy to the Lord and brought in to the treasury of the Lord.”
parts: But all the silver, the gold, the bronze or the iron shall be holy to the Lord and brought in to the treasury of the Lord.”

parts: So the priests sounded the trumpets, and when the people heard the sound of the trumpets, all the people shouted together with a great and mighty shout.

verses.text: Joshua put the city under a curse with the edge of the sword, and whatever was in it: from man to woman, from young man to old man, and from calf to donkey.
parts: Joshua put the city under a curse with the edge of the sword, and whatever was in it: from man to woman, from young man to old man, and from calf to donkey.

verses.text: Then Joshua said to the two young men who acted as spies, “Go into the house of the woman, and bring her out from there, and whatever she has.”
parts: Then Joshua said to the two young men who acted as spies, “Go into the house of the woman, and bring her out from there, and whatever she has.”

verses.text: So the two young men who had spied out the city went into the house of the woman and brought out Rahab the harlot, her father and mother, and her brothers and kindred, and all she possessed.
parts: So the two young men who had spied out the city went into the house of the woman and brought out Rahab the harlot, her father and mother, and her brothers and kindred, and all she possessed.

verses.text: and the city, with everyone in it, was set on fire; but the silver, the gold, the bronze, and the iron they brought into the treasury of the Lord.
parts: and the city, with everyone in it, was set on fire; but the silver, the gold, the bronze, and the iron they brought into the treasury of the Lord.

verses.text: Thus Joshua kept alive Rahab the harlot and all the house of her father, and caused her to dwell in Israel to this very day, because she hid the spies Joshua sent to spy out Jericho. Joshua adjured Israel on that day before the Lord, saying, “Cursed be the man who rebuilds that city.
parts: Thus Joshua kept alive Rahab the harlot and all the house of her father, and caused her to dwell in Israel to this very day, because she hid the spies Joshua sent to spy out Jericho.
Joshua adjured Israel on that day before the Lord, saying, “Cursed be the man who rebuilds that city.

verses.text: Joshua adjured Israel on that day before the Lord, saying, “Cursed be the man who rebuilds that city.
parts: Joshua adjured Israel on that day before the Lord, saying, “Cursed be the man who rebuilds that city.

verses.text: So the Lord was with Joshua, and his name was known throughout all the land.
parts: So the Lord was with Joshua, and his name was known throughout all the land.

verses.text: But the children of Israel committed a great offense, for they kept back for themselves something from what was accursed.
parts: But the children of Israel committed a great offense, for they kept back for themselves something from what was accursed.

verses.text: Then Joshua sent men into Ai, which is near Bethel, saying, “Spy out Ai.” So the men went up, and spied out Ai.
parts: Then Joshua sent men into Ai, which is near Bethel, saying, “Spy out Ai.” So the men went up, and spied out Ai.

verses.text: After this, they returned to Joshua and said to him, “Let not all the people go up, but let about two or three thousand men go up and force the city to surrender.
parts: After this, they returned to Joshua and said to him, “Let not all the people go up, but let about two or three thousand men go up and force the city to surrender.

verses.text: Thus, about three thousand men went up, but they fled from the face of the men of Ai.
parts: Thus, about three thousand men went up, but they fled from the face of the men of Ai.

verses.text: The men of Ai killed thirty-six of them and pursued them from the gate; and they crushed them on the steep slope.
parts: The men of Ai killed thirty-six of them and pursued them from the gate; and they crushed them on the steep slope.

verses.text: Then Joshua tore his clothes and fell to the ground before the face of the Lord until evening, both he and the elders of Israel, and they put dust on their heads. Joshua said, “I beseech You, O Lord.
parts: Then Joshua tore his clothes and fell to the ground before the face of the Lord until evening, both he and the elders of Israel, and they put dust on their heads.
Joshua said, “I beseech You, O Lord.

verses.text: Joshua said, “I beseech You, O Lord.
parts: Joshua said, “I beseech You, O Lord.

verses.text: What shall I say, since Israel turned his back before his enemy?
parts: What shall I say, since Israel turned his back before his enemy?

verses.text: When the Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land hear this, they will surround us and destroy us from off the land.
parts: When the Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land hear this, they will surround us and destroy us from off the land.

verses.text: So the Lord said to Joshua, “Rise up.
parts: So the Lord said to Joshua, “Rise up.

verses.text: The people sinned and transgressed the covenant I made with them; for they stole something from what was accursed and put it among their goods.
parts: The people sinned and transgressed the covenant I made with them; for they stole something from what was accursed and put it among their goods.

verses.text: So the sons of Israel will be unable to stand against the face of their enemies.
parts: So the sons of Israel will be unable to stand against the face of their enemies.

verses.text: Rise up and sanctify the people; and tell them to be sanctified for tomorrow.
parts: Rise up and sanctify the people; and tell them to be sanctified for tomorrow.

verses.text: In the morning you shall all be gathered together by your tribes, and it shall come to pass that the tribe the Lord points out, you shall bring forward family by family.
parts: In the morning you shall all be gathered together by your tribes, and it shall come to pass that the tribe the Lord points out, you shall bring forward family by family.

verses.text: So whoever is pointed out, he shall be burned with fire along with whatever he has, because he transgressed the covenant of the Lord and brought lawlessness in Israel.’ ”
parts: So whoever is pointed out, he shall be burned with fire along with whatever he has, because he transgressed the covenant of the Lord and brought lawlessness in Israel.’ ”

verses.text: Now Joshua arose early in the morning and gathered the people tribe by tribe; and the tribe of Judah was pointed out.
parts: Now Joshua arose early in the morning and gathered the people tribe by tribe; and the tribe of Judah was pointed out.

verses.text: Then he brought family by family, and the family of Zara was pointed out.
parts: Then he brought family by family, and the family of Zara was pointed out.

verses.text: and Achan, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, was pointed out.
parts: and Achan, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, was pointed out.

verses.text: Thus, Joshua said to Achan, “Give glory to the Lord God of Israel today and make confession.
parts: Thus, Joshua said to Achan, “Give glory to the Lord God of Israel today and make confession.

verses.text: So Achan answered Joshua and said, “Truly, I have sinned against the Lord God of Israel.
parts: So Achan answered Joshua and said, “Truly, I have sinned against the Lord God of Israel.

verses.text: I saw a beautiful, multicolored garment in the spoil and two hundred shekels of silver, and a wedge of fifty shekels of gold.
parts: I saw a beautiful, multicolored garment in the spoil and two hundred shekels of silver, and a wedge of fifty shekels of gold.

verses.text: Then Joshua sent messengers, and they ran to the tent in the camp.
parts: Then Joshua sent messengers, and they ran to the tent in the camp.

verses.text: They carried them from the tent; and they brought them to Joshua and the elders of Israel and placed them before the Lord.
parts: They carried them from the tent; and they brought them to Joshua and the elders of Israel and placed them before the Lord.

verses.text: After this, Joshua took Achan the son of Zerah and led him up to the Valley of Achor, along with his sons and daughters, and his calves, and all his donkeys and sheep, and his tent and all his belongings.
parts: After this, Joshua took Achan the son of Zerah and led him up to the Valley of Achor, along with his sons and daughters, and his calves, and all his donkeys and sheep, and his tent and all his belongings.

verses.text: And Joshua said to Achan, “Why did you destroy us?
parts: And Joshua said to Achan, “Why did you destroy us?

verses.text: and they put over him a great heap of stones, and the Lord ceased from the wrath of his anger.
parts: and they put over him a great heap of stones, and the Lord ceased from the wrath of his anger.

verses.text: The Lord said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid, nor be cowardly.
parts: The Lord said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid, nor be cowardly.

verses.text: You shall do to Ai as you did to Jericho and its king, and you will plunder for yourself the spoil of its cattle.
parts: You shall do to Ai as you did to Jericho and its king, and you will plunder for yourself the spoil of its cattle.

verses.text: So Joshua arose along with all the people of war to go up to Ai.
parts: So Joshua arose along with all the people of war to go up to Ai.

verses.text: He commanded them, saying, “You shall lie in ambush behind the city.
parts: He commanded them, saying, “You shall lie in ambush behind the city.

verses.text: But I and everyone with me will approach the city, and it shall come to pass that as the inhabitants of Ai come out to meet us, we at first shall flee from their face.
parts: But I and everyone with me will approach the city, and it shall come to pass that as the inhabitants of Ai come out to meet us, we at first shall flee from their face.

verses.text: Then as they come out after us, we will draw them away from the city.
parts: Then as they come out after us, we will draw them away from the city.

verses.text: Then you shall rise up from the ambush and go into the city.
parts: Then you shall rise up from the ambush and go into the city.

verses.text: You shall do according to this word.
parts: You shall do according to this word.

verses.text: So Joshua sent them out; and they went to the ambush site and waited between Bethel and Ai, westward of Ai.
parts: So Joshua sent them out; and they went to the ambush site and waited between Bethel and Ai, westward of Ai.

verses.text: Then Joshua rose early in the morning and visited the people; and he and the elders went up before the people to Ai.
parts: Then Joshua rose early in the morning and visited the people; and he and the elders went up before the people to Ai.

verses.text: All the men of war also went up with him; and they proceeded and came opposite the city eastward.
parts: All the men of war also went up with him; and they proceeded and came opposite the city eastward.

verses.text: But the ambush was on the west side of the city.
parts: But the ambush was on the west side of the city.

verses.text: Then it came to pass that when the king of Ai saw it, he hurried out and immediately went to meet them in battle, he and all the people with him.
parts: Then it came to pass that when the king of Ai saw it, he hurried out and immediately went to meet them in battle, he and all the people with him.

verses.text: So Joshua and Israel saw and retreated from before them.
parts: So Joshua and Israel saw and retreated from before them.

verses.text: They pursued after the sons of Israel, but were drawn further away from the city.
parts: They pursued after the sons of Israel, but were drawn further away from the city.

verses.text: There was no one left in Ai who did not pursue after Israel.
parts: There was no one left in Ai who did not pursue after Israel.

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Joshua, “Stretch out your hand with the spear in your hand toward the city, for I have given it into your hands; and the ambush will rise up quickly from their place.” So Joshua stretched out his hand with the spear toward the city, and when he stretched out his hand, those in ambush rose up quickly from their place and went into the city.
parts: Then the Lord said to Joshua, “Stretch out your hand with the spear in your hand toward the city, for I have given it into your hands; and the ambush will rise up quickly from their place.” So Joshua stretched out his hand with the spear toward the city,
and when he stretched out his hand, those in ambush rose up quickly from their place and went into the city.

verses.text: and when he stretched out his hand, those in ambush rose up quickly from their place and went into the city.
parts: and when he stretched out his hand, those in ambush rose up quickly from their place and went into the city.

verses.text: Then the inhabitants of Ai turned to look behind them and saw smoke rising from the city toward heaven.
parts: Then the inhabitants of Ai turned to look behind them and saw smoke rising from the city toward heaven.

verses.text: Then Joshua and all Israel saw that the men in ambush took the city, and that smoke from the city went up toward heaven; and they turned and struck down the men of Ai.
parts: Then Joshua and all Israel saw that the men in ambush took the city, and that smoke from the city went up toward heaven; and they turned and struck down the men of Ai.

verses.text: These came out from the city to meet them, and they were in the midst of this army, some on this side and some on that side.
parts: These came out from the city to meet them, and they were in the midst of this army, some on this side and some on that side.

verses.text: But they took the king of Ai alive and brought him to Joshua.
parts: But they took the king of Ai alive and brought him to Joshua.

verses.text: Thus, when the sons of Israel ceased killing all those in Ai who were in the plains and in the mountain on the slope, where they pursued them to the end, then Joshua returned to Ai and struck it with the edge of the sword.
parts: Thus, when the sons of Israel ceased killing all those in Ai who were in the plains and in the mountain on the slope, where they pursued them to the end, then Joshua returned to Ai and struck it with the edge of the sword.

verses.text: Those who fell that day, both men and women, were twelve thousand—all the inhabitants of Ai.
parts: Those who fell that day, both men and women, were twelve thousand—all the inhabitants of Ai.

verses.text: But the cattle and the spoils in the city, everything which the sons of Israel took as spoils, they did according to the ordinance of the Lord, in the manner the Lord commanded Joshua.
parts: But the cattle and the spoils in the city, everything which the sons of Israel took as spoils, they did according to the ordinance of the Lord, in the manner the Lord commanded Joshua.

verses.text: Then Joshua burned the city with fire; he made it an uninhabited heap forever, even to this day.
parts: Then Joshua burned the city with fire; he made it an uninhabited heap forever, even to this day.

verses.text: The king of Ai was hanged on a forked tree, and he remained on the tree until evening.
parts: The king of Ai was hanged on a forked tree, and he remained on the tree until evening.

verses.text: When the kings of the Amorites on the other side of the Jordan, and those in the hills and in the lowland, and in all the coasts of the Great Sea, and those near Lebanon, and the Hittites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, the Amorites, the Girgashites and the Jebusites heard what happened, they all came together in one place to war against Joshua and Israel.
parts: When the kings of the Amorites on the other side of the Jordan, and those in the hills and in the lowland, and in all the coasts of the Great Sea, and those near Lebanon, and the Hittites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, the Amorites, the Girgashites and the Jebusites heard what happened, they all came together in one place to war against Joshua and Israel.

verses.text: Then Joshua built an altar to the Lord, the God of Israel, on Mount Ebal, which Moses the servant of the Lord commanded the sons of Israel as written in the Law of Moses concerning an altar of whole stones, upon which an iron tool should not be laid.
parts: Then Joshua built an altar to the Lord, the God of Israel, on Mount Ebal,
which Moses the servant of the Lord commanded the sons of Israel as written in the Law of Moses concerning an altar of whole stones, upon which an iron tool should not be laid.

verses.text: which Moses the servant of the Lord commanded the sons of Israel as written in the Law of Moses concerning an altar of whole stones, upon which an iron tool should not be laid.
parts: which Moses the servant of the Lord commanded the sons of Israel as written in the Law of Moses concerning an altar of whole stones, upon which an iron tool should not be laid.

verses.text: Joshua also wrote on stones the second law of the law of Moses, which he wrote in the presence of the sons of Israel.
parts: Joshua also wrote on stones the second law of the law of Moses, which he wrote in the presence of the sons of Israel.

verses.text: All Israel and their elders and judges and their scribes also passed by on each side of the ark.
parts: All Israel and their elders and judges and their scribes also passed by on each side of the ark.

verses.text: Thus after this, Joshua read all the words of this law, the blessings and the curses, according to everything written in the Law of Moses.
parts: Thus after this, Joshua read all the words of this law, the blessings and the curses, according to everything written in the Law of Moses.

verses.text: There was not a word from everything Moses commanded Joshua that Joshua did not read in the ears of all the assembly of the children of Israel, to the men, women, and children, and to the resident aliens who came with Israel.
parts: There was not a word from everything Moses commanded Joshua that Joshua did not read in the ears of all the assembly of the children of Israel, to the men, women, and children, and to the resident aliens who came with Israel.

verses.text: When the inhabitants of Gibeon heard everything the Lord did to Jericho and Ai, indeed they also devised a crafty plan.
parts: When the inhabitants of Gibeon heard everything the Lord did to Jericho and Ai,
indeed they also devised a crafty plan.

verses.text: indeed they also devised a crafty plan.
parts: indeed they also devised a crafty plan.

verses.text: The upper part of their shoes and sandals were old and crudely patched on their feet; and the clothing they wore was worn out.
parts: The upper part of their shoes and sandals were old and crudely patched on their feet; and the clothing they wore was worn out.

verses.text: Then they came to Joshua at Israel's camp in Gilgal and said to Joshua and Israel, “We have come from a far land.
parts: Then they came to Joshua at Israel's camp in Gilgal and said to Joshua and Israel, “We have come from a far land.

verses.text: The children of Israel said to the Hivites, “Perhaps you live among us.
parts: The children of Israel said to the Hivites, “Perhaps you live among us.

verses.text: So they replied to Joshua, “We are your servants.” Joshua then said to them, “Who are you, and where do you come from?”
parts: So they replied to Joshua, “We are your servants.” Joshua then said to them, “Who are you, and where do you come from?”

verses.text: So they said, “Your servants have come from a very distant land in the name of the Lord your God; for we heard of His name, and everything He did in Egypt,
parts: So they said, “Your servants have come from a very distant land in the name of the Lord your God; for we heard of His name, and everything He did in Egypt,

verses.text: and everything He did to the kings of the Amorites who were beyond the Jordan, to Sihon the king of Heshbon and to Og the king of Bashan, who dwelled in Ashtaroth and Edrei.
parts: and everything He did to the kings of the Amorites who were beyond the Jordan, to Sihon the king of Heshbon and to Og the king of Bashan, who dwelled in Ashtaroth and Edrei.

verses.text: “So when we heard this, our elders and all those who inhabited our land spoke to us, saying, ‘Take provisions for yourselves for the road, and go to meet them and say to them, “We are your servants.
parts: “So when we heard this, our elders and all those who inhabited our land spoke to us, saying, ‘Take provisions for yourselves for the road, and go to meet them and say to them, “We are your servants.

verses.text: These are the loaves of bread, and we took them hot for our journey on the day we left to come to you; but now they are dried and have become moldy.
parts: These are the loaves of bread, and we took them hot for our journey on the day we left to come to you; but now they are dried and have become moldy.

verses.text: These are the wineskins we filled when new; but they are torn, and our clothing and shoes are old because of the very long journey.”
parts: These are the wineskins we filled when new; but they are torn, and our clothing and shoes are old because of the very long journey.”

verses.text: Then the rulers took some of their provisions, but they did not inquire of the Lord.
parts: Then the rulers took some of their provisions, but they did not inquire of the Lord.

verses.text: Joshua then made peace with them and established a covenant to keep them safe; and the rulers of the congregation swore to them.
parts: Joshua then made peace with them and established a covenant to keep them safe; and the rulers of the congregation swore to them.

verses.text: Now it came to pass that three days after they made a covenant with them, they heard that they were near neighbors and that they dwelt among them.
parts: Now it came to pass that three days after they made a covenant with them, they heard that they were near neighbors and that they dwelt among them.

verses.text: Then the children of Israel departed and came to their cities.
parts: Then the children of Israel departed and came to their cities.

verses.text: The sons of Israel did not fight with them, because all the rulers had sworn to them by the Lord God of Israel; but all the congregation complained against the rulers.
parts: The sons of Israel did not fight with them, because all the rulers had sworn to them by the Lord God of Israel; but all the congregation complained against the rulers.

verses.text: So the rulers said to all the congregation, “We swore an oath to them by the Lord God of Israel, and now we cannot touch them.
parts: So the rulers said to all the congregation, “We swore an oath to them by the Lord God of Israel, and now we cannot touch them.

verses.text: This is what we will do.
parts: This is what we will do.

verses.text: They shall live, but they shall be woodcutters and water-carriers for the entire congregation, as the rulers direct them.”
parts: They shall live, but they shall be woodcutters and water-carriers for the entire congregation, as the rulers direct them.”

verses.text: Thus Joshua summoned them together and spoke to them, saying, “Why have you deceived me, saying, ‘We are very far from you,’ when you are fellow-countrymen of those who dwell among us?
parts: Thus Joshua summoned them together and spoke to them, saying, “Why have you deceived me, saying, ‘We are very far from you,’ when you are fellow-countrymen of those who dwell among us?

verses.text: Now therefore, you are cursed, and there shall not fail to be a servant nor a woodcutter among you to serve me and my God.”
parts: Now therefore, you are cursed, and there shall not fail to be a servant nor a woodcutter among you to serve me and my God.”

verses.text: So they answered Joshua, saying, “It was reported to us what the Lord your God ordered His servant Moses, to give you this land and to destroy us and all who dwell in it from before you.
parts: So they answered Joshua, saying, “It was reported to us what the Lord your God ordered His servant Moses, to give you this land and to destroy us and all who dwell in it from before you.

verses.text: Now behold, we are in your hands, do to us as it is pleases you and as it seems good to you.”
parts: Now behold, we are in your hands, do to us as it is pleases you and as it seems good to you.”

verses.text: So they did this to them in this way, and Joshua delivered them on that day from the hands of the children of Israel; and they did not kill them.
parts: So they did this to them in this way, and Joshua delivered them on that day from the hands of the children of Israel; and they did not kill them.

verses.text: On that day, Joshua appointed them to be woodcutters and water-carriers for the entire congregation and for the altar of God.
parts: On that day, Joshua appointed them to be woodcutters and water-carriers for the entire congregation and for the altar of God.

verses.text: When Adoni-Zedek king of Jerusalem heard that Joshua had taken Ai and utterly destroyed it; and that as he had done to Jericho and its king, he did also to Ai and its king; and that the inhabitants of Gibeon by their own accord had come over to Joshua and Israel, then they feared greatly for themselves, for the king knew that Gibeon was a great city, as one of the mother-cities, and that all her men were mighty.
parts: When Adoni-Zedek king of Jerusalem heard that Joshua had taken Ai and utterly destroyed it; and that as he had done to Jericho and its king, he did also to Ai and its king; and that the inhabitants of Gibeon by their own accord had come over to Joshua and Israel, then they feared greatly for themselves, for the king knew that Gibeon was a great city, as one of the mother-cities, and that all her men were mighty.

verses.text: So Adoni-Zedek king of Jerusalem sent to Hoham king of Hebron, to Piram king of Jarmuth, to Japhia king of Lachish, and to Debir king of Eglon, saying, “Come up to me and help me; and we will go to war against Gibeon, for they went over of their own accord to Joshua and the children of Israel.” The five kings of the Jebusites: the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon, they and all their people, went up and besieged Gibeon and forced it to surrender.
parts: So Adoni-Zedek king of Jerusalem sent to Hoham king of Hebron, to Piram king of Jarmuth, to Japhia king of Lachish, and to Debir king of Eglon, saying, “Come up to me and help me; and we will go to war against Gibeon, for they went over of their own accord to Joshua and the children of Israel.” The five kings of the Jebusites: the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon, they and all their people, went up and besieged Gibeon and forced it to surrender.

verses.text: “Come up to me and help me; and we will go to war against Gibeon, for they went over of their own accord to Joshua and the children of Israel.”
parts: “Come up to me and help me; and we will go to war against Gibeon, for they went over of their own accord to Joshua and the children of Israel.”

verses.text: The five kings of the Jebusites: the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon, they and all their people, went up and besieged Gibeon and forced it to surrender.
parts: The five kings of the Jebusites: the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon, they and all their people, went up and besieged Gibeon and forced it to surrender.

verses.text: Then the inhabitants of Gibeon sent to Joshua in the camp of Israel at Gilgal, saying, “Do not abandon your servants.
parts: Then the inhabitants of Gibeon sent to Joshua in the camp of Israel at Gilgal, saying, “Do not abandon your servants.

verses.text: So Joshua went up from Gilgal, he and all his men of war, everyone mighty in strength.
parts: So Joshua went up from Gilgal, he and all his men of war, everyone mighty in strength.

verses.text: For the Lord said to Joshua, “Do not fear them, for I have delivered them into your hands.
parts: For the Lord said to Joshua, “Do not fear them, for I have delivered them into your hands.

verses.text: Then Joshua came upon them suddenly, for he had marched all night from Gilgal.
parts: Then Joshua came upon them suddenly, for he had marched all night from Gilgal.

verses.text: The Lord routed them from the face of the sons of Israel, and the Lord crushed them with a great destruction at Gibeon.
parts: The Lord routed them from the face of the sons of Israel, and the Lord crushed them with a great destruction at Gibeon.

verses.text: But as they fled from the face of the sons of Israel, on the descent of Beth Horon, the Lord cast down hailstones on them from heaven as far as Azekah.
parts: But as they fled from the face of the sons of Israel, on the descent of Beth Horon, the Lord cast down hailstones on them from heaven as far as Azekah.

verses.text: Then Joshua spoke to the Lord on the day God delivered the Amorites into the hands of Israel, when he crushed them in Gibeon.
parts: Then Joshua spoke to the Lord on the day God delivered the Amorites into the hands of Israel, when he crushed them in Gibeon.

verses.text: There was no day like that day either before or after, that God should hear a man, because the Lord joined in war with Israel.
parts: There was no day like that day either before or after, that God should hear a man, because the Lord joined in war with Israel.

verses.text: Then those five kings fled, and hid in the cave at Makkedah.
parts: Then those five kings fled, and hid in the cave at Makkedah.

verses.text: So it was reported to Joshua, saying, “The five kings were found hiding in the cave in Makkedah.”
parts: So it was reported to Joshua, saying, “The five kings were found hiding in the cave in Makkedah.”

verses.text: Joshua said, “Roll stones against the mouth of the cave and set men to guard them.
parts: Joshua said, “Roll stones against the mouth of the cave and set men to guard them.

verses.text: As for you, do not stay there; but pursue your enemies and attack their rear guard.
parts: As for you, do not stay there; but pursue your enemies and attack their rear guard.

verses.text: Thus it came to pass that when Joshua and the sons of Israel ceased to strike them in an overwhelming slaughter, those who escaped took refuge in the fortified cities.
parts: Thus it came to pass that when Joshua and the sons of Israel ceased to strike them in an overwhelming slaughter, those who escaped took refuge in the fortified cities.

verses.text: Then all the people returned safely to Joshua at Makkedah, and not one of the sons of Israel grumbled with his tongue.
parts: Then all the people returned safely to Joshua at Makkedah, and not one of the sons of Israel grumbled with his tongue.

verses.text: Then Joshua said, “Unblock the cave and bring out these five kings from the cave.” So they brought out the five kings from the cave: the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon.
parts: Then Joshua said, “Unblock the cave and bring out these five kings from the cave.” So they brought out the five kings from the cave: the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon.

verses.text: So they brought out the five kings from the cave: the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon.
parts: So they brought out the five kings from the cave: the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon.

verses.text: When they brought them to Joshua, he called together all Israel and the leaders of the army who went with him, saying, “Come forward and put your feet on their necks.” So they came forward and placed their feet on their necks.
parts: When they brought them to Joshua, he called together all Israel and the leaders of the army who went with him, saying, “Come forward and put your feet on their necks.” So they came forward and placed their feet on their necks.

verses.text: Then Joshua said to them, “Do not be afraid of them, nor be fearful.
parts: Then Joshua said to them, “Do not be afraid of them, nor be fearful.

verses.text: After this, Joshua put them to death and hanged them on five trees.
parts: After this, Joshua put them to death and hanged them on five trees.

verses.text: Then it came to pass that towards sunset Joshua gave orders, and they took them down from the trees and cast them into the cave where they had fled for refuge.
parts: Then it came to pass that towards sunset Joshua gave orders, and they took them down from the trees and cast them into the cave where they had fled for refuge.

verses.text: Then they took Makkedah that day and struck it with the edge of the sword.
parts: Then they took Makkedah that day and struck it with the edge of the sword.

verses.text: Then Joshua and all Israel with him departed from Makkedah to Libnah and besieged Libnah.
parts: Then Joshua and all Israel with him departed from Makkedah to Libnah and besieged Libnah.

verses.text: The Lord gave it into the hands of Israel.
parts: The Lord gave it into the hands of Israel.

verses.text: After this, Joshua and all Israel with him departed from Libnah to Lachish, and encamped around it and besieged it.
parts: After this, Joshua and all Israel with him departed from Libnah to Lachish, and encamped around it and besieged it.

verses.text: The Lord also gave Lachish into the hands of Israel.
parts: The Lord also gave Lachish into the hands of Israel.

verses.text: Then Horam the king of Gezer marched up to help Lachish, but Joshua smote him and his people with the edge of the sword, until not one of them was spared or allowed to escape.
parts: Then Horam the king of Gezer marched up to help Lachish, but Joshua smote him and his people with the edge of the sword, until not one of them was spared or allowed to escape.

verses.text: Then Joshua and all Israel with him departed from Lachish to Eglon, and encamped around it and besieged it.
parts: Then Joshua and all Israel with him departed from Lachish to Eglon, and encamped around it and besieged it.

verses.text: So the Lord gave it into Israel's hand; and they took it on that day and destroyed it with the edge of the sword.
parts: So the Lord gave it into Israel's hand; and they took it on that day and destroyed it with the edge of the sword.

verses.text: After this, Joshua and all Israel with him departed to Hebron and encamped around it.
parts: After this, Joshua and all Israel with him departed to Hebron and encamped around it.

verses.text: He struck it with the edge of the sword, along with every living thing in it.
parts: He struck it with the edge of the sword, along with every living thing in it.

verses.text: Then Joshua and all Israel returned to Debir and encamped around it.
parts: Then Joshua and all Israel returned to Debir and encamped around it.

verses.text: They took it, its king, and its villages, and struck it with the edge of the sword.
parts: They took it, its king, and its villages, and struck it with the edge of the sword.

verses.text: After this, Joshua smote all the land of the hill country, and the South, and the plains of the land, and Asedoth, and her kings; and not one of them was spared.
parts: After this, Joshua smote all the land of the hill country, and the South, and the plains of the land, and Asedoth, and her kings; and not one of them was spared.

verses.text: from Kadesh Barnea to Gaza, and all of Goshen, as far as Gibeon.
parts: from Kadesh Barnea to Gaza, and all of Goshen, as far as Gibeon.

verses.text: Joshua smote their kings and their land once for all, because the Lord God of Israel was fighting for Israel.
parts: Joshua smote their kings and their land once for all, because the Lord God of Israel was fighting for Israel.

verses.text: But when Jabin the king of Hazor heard this, he sent to Jobab king of Madon, to the king of Shimron, to the king of Achshaph, to the kings from the north in the mountains, and in the plain south of Chinneroth in the lowland, and in the heights of Dor on the west, to the Canaanites in the east and the west: the Amorite, the Hittite, the Perizzite, the Jebusite in the mountains, and the Hivite below Hermon in the land of Mizpah.
parts: But when Jabin the king of Hazor heard this, he sent to Jobab king of Madon, to the king of Shimron, to the king of Achshaph, to the kings from the north in the mountains, and in the plain south of Chinneroth in the lowland, and in the heights of Dor on the west, to the Canaanites in the east and the west: the Amorite, the Hittite, the Perizzite, the Jebusite in the mountains, and the Hivite below Hermon in the land of Mizpah.

verses.text: They and their kings with them, as many in number as the sand of the sea, went out with a great many horses and chariots.
parts: They and their kings with them, as many in number as the sand of the sea, went out with a great many horses and chariots.

verses.text: All these kings came together to meet and camp together by the waters of Merom to war against Israel.
parts: All these kings came together to meet and camp together by the waters of Merom to war against Israel.

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Joshua, “Fear not before their presence, for tomorrow at this hour, I will deliver them to you and put them to flight in the sight of Israel.
parts: Then the Lord said to Joshua, “Fear not before their presence, for tomorrow at this hour, I will deliver them to you and put them to flight in the sight of Israel.

verses.text: So Joshua and all the people of war went against them suddenly at the waters of Merom and attacked them in the hill country.
parts: So Joshua and all the people of war went against them suddenly at the waters of Merom and attacked them in the hill country.

verses.text: The Lord delivered them into the hands of Israel, and they defeated and chased them to Sidon, the Great Sidon, to Brook Misrephoth, and eastward to the Valley of Mizpah.
parts: The Lord delivered them into the hands of Israel, and they defeated and chased them to Sidon, the Great Sidon, to Brook Misrephoth, and eastward to the Valley of Mizpah.

verses.text: Thus Joshua did to them as the Lord commanded him.
parts: Thus Joshua did to them as the Lord commanded him.

verses.text: At that time, Joshua returned and seized Hazor and its king; for Hazor ruled over all these kingdoms in previous times.
parts: At that time, Joshua returned and seized Hazor and its king; for Hazor ruled over all these kingdoms in previous times.

verses.text: They put to death every living thing in it with the sword.
parts: They put to death every living thing in it with the sword.

verses.text: Joshua captured all the cities of their kingdoms and their kings, and put them to death by the edge of the sword.
parts: Joshua captured all the cities of their kingdoms and their kings, and put them to death by the edge of the sword.

verses.text: But Israel did not burn any of the fortified cities.
parts: But Israel did not burn any of the fortified cities.

verses.text: The children of Israel took all its spoils for themselves, and they completely destroyed everyone with the edge of the sword, until there were no survivors.
parts: The children of Israel took all its spoils for themselves, and they completely destroyed everyone with the edge of the sword, until there were no survivors.

verses.text: As the Lord ordered his servant Moses, so Moses commanded Joshua, and so Joshua did.
parts: As the Lord ordered his servant Moses, so Moses commanded Joshua, and so Joshua did.

verses.text: After this, Joshua took all the hill country of the land, all the South, all the land of Goshen, the plains of the land, the land to the west, the mountain of Israel, the low country toward the mountain, from Mount Halak to the ascent to Seir, even as far as Baal Gad and the plains of Lebanon below Mount Hermon.
parts: After this, Joshua took all the hill country of the land, all the South, all the land of Goshen, the plains of the land, the land to the west, the mountain of Israel, the low country toward the mountain, from Mount Halak to the ascent to Seir, even as far as Baal Gad and the plains of Lebanon below Mount Hermon.

verses.text: toward the mountain, from Mount Halak to the ascent to Seir, even as far as Baal Gad and the plains of Lebanon below Mount Hermon.
parts: toward the mountain, from Mount Halak to the ascent to Seir, even as far as Baal Gad and the plains of Lebanon below Mount Hermon.

verses.text: Joshua waged war with these kings for many days,
parts: Joshua waged war with these kings for many days,

verses.text: and there was not a city Israel did not take.
parts: and there was not a city Israel did not take.

verses.text: For it was of the Lord to harden their heart to wage war against Israel, that they might be utterly destroyed and be shown no mercy, but that they might be utterly destroyed, as the Lord said to Moses.
parts: For it was of the Lord to harden their heart to wage war against Israel, that they might be utterly destroyed and be shown no mercy, but that they might be utterly destroyed, as the Lord said to Moses.

verses.text: At that time, Joshua came and utterly destroyed the Anakim from the mountains: from Hebron, from Debir, from Anab, and from all the nation of Israel, and from all the mountains of Judah, including their cities.
parts: At that time, Joshua came and utterly destroyed the Anakim from the mountains: from Hebron, from Debir, from Anab, and from all the nation of Israel, and from all the mountains of Judah, including their cities.

verses.text: No Anakim remained in the midst of the children of Israel, but only in Gaza, in Gath, and in Ashdod.
parts: No Anakim remained in the midst of the children of Israel, but only in Gaza, in Gath, and in Ashdod.

verses.text: So Joshua took all the land, as the Lord commanded Moses, and Joshua gave it as an inheritance to Israel by division, according to their tribes.
parts: So Joshua took all the land, as the Lord commanded Moses, and Joshua gave it as an inheritance to Israel by division, according to their tribes.

verses.text: Now these are the kings of the land whom the sons of Israel put to death, and whose land they inherited beyond the Jordan in the east, from the valley Arnon to Mount Hermon, and all the land of Araba in the east. These kings were Sihon, king of the Amorites, who dwelt in Heshbon and ruled from Aroer, which is in the valley, over part of the valley and half of Gilead toward Jabok, the border of the sons of Ammon, and Araba towards the sea of Chinneroth to the east, and as far as the Sea of Araba (the Salt Sea) from the east, the way toward Beth Jeshimoth, and from Teman below Ashdoth Pisgah; and Og, king of Bashan, who remained from the giants who dwelt in Ashtaroth and Edrei, and who ruled from Mount Hermon and from Salcah, and all Bashan as far as the borders of the Geshurites, and the Maachathites and half of Gilead, to the borders of Sihon the king of Heshbon.
parts: Now these are the kings of the land whom the sons of Israel put to death, and whose land they inherited beyond the Jordan in the east, from the valley Arnon to Mount Hermon, and all the land of Araba in the east.

These kings were Sihon, king of the Amorites, who dwelt in Heshbon and ruled from Aroer, which is in the valley, over part of the valley and half of Gilead toward Jabok, the border of the sons of Ammon, and Araba towards the sea of Chinneroth to the east, and as far as the Sea of Araba (the Salt Sea) from the east, the way toward Beth Jeshimoth, and from Teman below Ashdoth Pisgah; and Og, king of Bashan, who remained from the giants who dwelt in Ashtaroth and Edrei, and who ruled from Mount Hermon and from Salcah, and all Bashan as far as the borders of the Geshurites, and the Maachathites and half of Gilead, to the borders of Sihon the king of Heshbon.

verses.text: Moses the servant of the Lord and the sons of Israel struck them down, and Moses gave them as a possession to Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
parts: Moses the servant of the Lord and the sons of Israel struck them down, and Moses gave them as a possession to Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.

verses.text: Now these are the kings of the Amorites whom Joshua and the sons of Israel put to death on the other side of the Jordan by the sea of Baal Gad in the plain of Lebanon, and as far as Mount Halak and the ascent to Seir; and Joshua gave this to the tribes of Israel to inherit according to their portion, in the mountain and in the plain, in Araba and in Ashdoth, in the desert and in the South—the Hittites, the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
parts: Now these are the kings of the Amorites whom Joshua and the sons of Israel put to death on the other side of the Jordan by the sea of Baal Gad in the plain of Lebanon, and as far as Mount Halak and the ascent to Seir; and Joshua gave this to the tribes of Israel to inherit according to their portion, in the mountain and in the plain, in Araba and in Ashdoth, in the desert and in the South—the Hittites, the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.

verses.text: in the mountain and in the plain, in Araba and in Ashdoth, in the desert and in the South—the Hittites, the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
parts: in the mountain and in the plain, in Araba and in Ashdoth, in the desert and in the South—the Hittites, the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.

verses.text: The kings of these were the king of Jericho, the king of Ai, which is near Bethel,
parts: The kings of these were the king of Jericho, the king of Ai, which is near Bethel,

verses.text: the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron,
parts: the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron,

verses.text: the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish,
parts: the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish,

verses.text: the king of Eglon, the king of Gezer,
parts: the king of Eglon, the king of Gezer,

verses.text: the king of Debir, the king of Geder,
parts: the king of Debir, the king of Geder,

verses.text: the king of Hormah, the king of Arad,
parts: the king of Hormah, the king of Arad,

verses.text: the king of Libna, the king of Adullam,
parts: the king of Libna, the king of Adullam,

verses.text: the king of Makkedah, the king of Bethel,
parts: the king of Makkedah, the king of Bethel,

verses.text: the king of Tappuah, the king of Hepher,
parts: the king of Tappuah, the king of Hepher,

verses.text: the king of Aphek, the king of Lasharon,
parts: the king of Aphek, the king of Lasharon,

verses.text: the king of Madon, the king of Hazor,
parts: the king of Madon, the king of Hazor,

verses.text: the king of Shimron Meron, the king of Achshaph,
parts: the king of Shimron Meron, the king of Achshaph,

verses.text: the king of Taanach, the king of Megiddo,
parts: the king of Taanach, the king of Megiddo,

verses.text: the king of Kedesh, the king of Jokneam in Carmel,
parts: the king of Kedesh, the king of Jokneam in Carmel,

verses.text: the king of Dor in the heights of Dor, the king of the people of Gilgal,
parts: the king of Dor in the heights of Dor, the king of the people of Gilgal,

verses.text: and the king of Tirzah—all these kings equaled thirty-one.
parts: and the king of Tirzah—all these kings equaled thirty-one.

verses.text: Now Joshua was old and advanced in days, and the Lord said to Joshua, “You are advanced in days, and much land remains to inherit. The remaining land is the territories of the Philistines, the Geshurites, and the Canaanites; from Sihor, east of Egypt, as far as the borders of Ekron northward (which is counted as Canaanite); the five lords of the Philistines—the Gazites, the Ashdodites, the Ashkelonites, the Gittites, the Ekronites; and also the Avites; from the south, all the land of the Canaanites, and Mearah that belongs to the Sidonians as far as Aphek, to the border of the Amorites; the land of the Gebalites, and all Lebanon, toward the sunrise, from Baal Gad below Mount Hermon as far as the entrance to Hamath; all the inhabitants of the mountains, from Lebanon as far as the Brook Misrephoth, and all the Sidonians—them I will drive out from before the children of Israel; only divide it by lot to Israel as an inheritance, as I have commanded you.
parts: Now Joshua was old and advanced in days, and the Lord said to Joshua, “You are advanced in days, and much land remains to inherit.

The remaining land is the territories of the Philistines, the Geshurites, and the Canaanites; from Sihor, east of Egypt, as far as the borders of Ekron northward (which is counted as Canaanite); the five lords of the Philistines—the Gazites, the Ashdodites, the Ashkelonites, the Gittites, the Ekronites; and also the Avites; from the south, all the land of the Canaanites, and Mearah that belongs to the Sidonians as far as Aphek, to the border of the Amorites; the land of the Gebalites, and all Lebanon, toward the sunrise, from Baal Gad below Mount Hermon as far as the entrance to Hamath; all the inhabitants of the mountains, from Lebanon as far as the Brook Misrephoth, and all the Sidonians—them I will drive out from before the children of Israel; only divide it by lot to Israel as an inheritance, as I have commanded you.

verses.text: Now therefore divide this land by lot to the nine tribes and to the half-tribe of Manasseh; from the Jordan as far as the Great Sea westward, you will give this to them, with the Great Sea as the boundary.”
parts: Now therefore divide this land by lot to the nine tribes and to the half-tribe of Manasseh; from the Jordan as far as the Great Sea westward, you will give this to them, with the Great Sea as the boundary.”

verses.text: But to the two tribes, the Reubenites and the Gadites, and to the half-tribe of Manasseh, Moses gave an inheritance beyond the Jordan.
parts: But to the two tribes, the Reubenites and the Gadites, and to the half-tribe of Manasseh, Moses gave an inheritance beyond the Jordan.

verses.text: from Aroer which is on the bank of the River Arnon, and the city in the midst of the valley, and the town in the midst of the ravine, and all the plain of Medeba as far as Dibon;
parts: from Aroer which is on the bank of the River Arnon, and the city in the midst of the valley, and the town in the midst of the ravine, and all the plain of Medeba as far as Dibon;

verses.text: all the cities of Sihon, the king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon, as far as the border of the children of Ammon;
parts: all the cities of Sihon, the king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon, as far as the border of the children of Ammon;

verses.text: Gilead, and the border of the Geshurites or the Maachathites, all Mount Hermon and all Bashan as far as Salcah;
parts: Gilead, and the border of the Geshurites or the Maachathites, all Mount Hermon and all Bashan as far as Salcah;

verses.text: all the kingdom of Og in Bashan, who reigned in Ashtaroth and Edrei, who remained of the remnant of the giants; for Moses had defeated and cast out these.
parts: all the kingdom of Og in Bashan, who reigned in Ashtaroth and Edrei, who remained of the remnant of the giants; for Moses had defeated and cast out these.

verses.text: Nevertheless, the children of Israel did not drive out the Geshurites or the Maachathites, but the Geshurites and the Maachathites dwell among the Israelites until this day.
parts: Nevertheless, the children of Israel did not drive out the Geshurites or the Maachathites, but the Geshurites and the Maachathites dwell among the Israelites until this day.

verses.text: Only the tribe of Levi he had given no inheritance, because their inheritance is the Lord God of Israel, as the Lord said to them.
parts: Only the tribe of Levi he had given no inheritance, because their inheritance is the Lord God of Israel, as the Lord said to them.

verses.text: Now Moses had given an inheritance to the tribe of Reuben according to their families.
parts: Now Moses had given an inheritance to the tribe of Reuben according to their families.

verses.text: Their territories were from Aroer, which is on the bank of the River Arnon, and the city in the ravine, and all the plain of Medeba;
parts: Their territories were from Aroer, which is on the bank of the River Arnon, and the city in the ravine, and all the plain of Medeba;

verses.text: Heshbon and all the cities in the plain: Dibon, Bamoth Baal, and Beth Baal Meon,
parts: Heshbon and all the cities in the plain: Dibon, Bamoth Baal, and Beth Baal Meon,

verses.text: Jahaza and Kedemoth, Mephaath,
parts: Jahaza and Kedemoth, Mephaath,

verses.text: Karjathaim, Sibmah, Zereth Shahar on the mountain of the valley,
parts: Karjathaim, Sibmah, Zereth Shahar on the mountain of the valley,

verses.text: and Beth Peor, the slopes of Pisgah, and Beth Jeshimoth—
parts: and Beth Peor, the slopes of Pisgah, and Beth Jeshimoth—

verses.text: and all the cities of the plain and all the kingdom of Sihon, king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon, whom Moses had struck with the princes of Midian: Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, who were princes of Sihon dwelling in the country.
parts: and all the cities of the plain and all the kingdom of Sihon, king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon, whom Moses had struck with the princes of Midian: Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, who were princes of Sihon dwelling in the country.

verses.text: The children of Israel also killed with the sword Balaam the son of Beor, the soothsayer, among those who were killed by them.
parts: The children of Israel also killed with the sword Balaam the son of Beor, the soothsayer, among those who were killed by them.

verses.text: The border of the children of Reuben was the bank of the Jordan.
parts: The border of the children of Reuben was the bank of the Jordan.

verses.text: Moses also had given an inheritance to the tribe of Gad, to the children of Gad according to their families.
parts: Moses also had given an inheritance to the tribe of Gad, to the children of Gad according to their families.

verses.text: Their boundary lines were Jazer, all the cities of Gilead, and half the land of the Ammonites as far as Aroer, which is before Rabbah,
parts: Their boundary lines were Jazer, all the cities of Gilead, and half the land of the Ammonites as far as Aroer, which is before Rabbah,

verses.text: and from Heshbon to Ramath Mizpah and Betonim, and from Mahanaim to the border of Debir,
parts: and from Heshbon to Ramath Mizpah and Betonim, and from Mahanaim to the border of Debir,

verses.text: and in the valley Beth Haram, Beth Nimrah, Succoth, and Zaphon, the rest of the kingdom of Sihon king of Heshbon, with the Jordan as its border, as far as the edge of the Sea of Chinnereth, on the other side of the Jordan eastward.
parts: and in the valley Beth Haram, Beth Nimrah, Succoth, and Zaphon, the rest of the kingdom of Sihon king of Heshbon, with the Jordan as its border, as far as the edge of the Sea of Chinnereth, on the other side of the Jordan eastward.

verses.text: This is the inheritance of the children of Gad according to their families, the cities, and their villages.
parts: This is the inheritance of the children of Gad according to their families, the cities, and their villages.

verses.text: Moses had also given an inheritance to the half tribe of Manasseh according to their families.
parts: Moses had also given an inheritance to the half tribe of Manasseh according to their families.

verses.text: Their boundary was from Mahanaim, all Bashan, all the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, and all the towns of Jair which are in Bashan, sixty cities;
parts: Their boundary was from Mahanaim, all Bashan, all the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, and all the towns of Jair which are in Bashan, sixty cities;

verses.text: half of Gilead, and Ashtaroth and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan, were for the children of Machir, the son of Manasseh, for half of the children of Machir according to their families.
parts: half of Gilead, and Ashtaroth and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan, were for the children of Machir, the son of Manasseh, for half of the children of Machir according to their families.

verses.text: These are the areas Moses had distributed as an inheritance beyond the plains of Moab on the other side of the Jordan, by Jericho eastward.
parts: These are the areas Moses had distributed as an inheritance beyond the plains of Moab on the other side of the Jordan, by Jericho eastward.

verses.text: These are the areas which the children of Israel inherited in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar the priest, Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers of the tribes of the children of Israel distributed as an inheritance to them.
parts: These are the areas which the children of Israel inherited in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar the priest, Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers of the tribes of the children of Israel distributed as an inheritance to them.

verses.text: Their inheritance was by lot, as the Lord commanded by the hand of Joshua for the nine tribes and the half-tribe.
parts: Their inheritance was by lot, as the Lord commanded by the hand of Joshua for the nine tribes and the half-tribe.

verses.text: For Moses had given the inheritance of the two tribes and the half-tribe on the other side of the Jordan; but to the Levites he had given no inheritance among them.
parts: For Moses had given the inheritance of the two tribes and the half-tribe on the other side of the Jordan; but to the Levites he had given no inheritance among them.

verses.text: For the children of Joseph were two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim; and they gave no part to the Levites in the land, except cities to dwell in, with common-lands for their livestock and their property.
parts: For the children of Joseph were two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim; and they gave no part to the Levites in the land, except cities to dwell in, with common-lands for their livestock and their property.

verses.text: As the Lord had commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did; and they divided the land.
parts: As the Lord had commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did; and they divided the land.

verses.text: Then the children of Judah came to Joshua in Gilgal, and Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenezite said to him, “You know what the Lord said to Moses the man of God concerning myself and you in Kadesh Barnea.
parts: Then the children of Judah came to Joshua in Gilgal, and Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenezite said to him, “You know what the Lord said to Moses the man of God concerning myself and you in Kadesh Barnea.

verses.text: For I was forty years old when Moses the servant of God sent me from Kadesh Barnea to spy out the land, and I brought back word to him as he wished,
parts: For I was forty years old when Moses the servant of God sent me from Kadesh Barnea to spy out the land, and I brought back word to him as he wished,

verses.text: but my brothers who went up with me turned aside the heart of the people, while I continued to follow the Lord my God.
parts: but my brothers who went up with me turned aside the heart of the people, while I continued to follow the Lord my God.

verses.text: So Moses swore on that day, saying, ‘The land on which you set foot shall be an inheritance for you and your children forever, because you continued to follow the Lord our God.’
parts: So Moses swore on that day, saying, ‘The land on which you set foot shall be an inheritance for you and your children forever, because you continued to follow the Lord our God.’

verses.text: Now the Lord has sustained me, as He said, these forty-five years, since the Lord spoke this word to Moses, and Israel wandered in the desert; and now behold I am eighty-five years old today.
parts: Now the Lord has sustained me, as He said, these forty-five years, since the Lord spoke this word to Moses, and Israel wandered in the desert; and now behold I am eighty-five years old today.

verses.text: I am still as strong today as when Moses sent me, as strong now to go out and come in for war.
parts: I am still as strong today as when Moses sent me, as strong now to go out and come in for war.

verses.text: Now therefore, I ask you for this mountain, as the Lord said in that day, since you heard this word in that day.
parts: Now therefore, I ask you for this mountain, as the Lord said in that day, since you heard this word in that day.

verses.text: So Joshua blessed him, and gave Hebron to Caleb the Son of Jephunneh, the son of Kenez, as an inheritance.
parts: So Joshua blessed him, and gave Hebron to Caleb the Son of Jephunneh, the son of Kenez, as an inheritance.

verses.text: Therefore Hebron became the inheritance of Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenezite to this day, because he followed the command of the Lord God of Israel.
parts: Therefore Hebron became the inheritance of Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenezite to this day, because he followed the command of the Lord God of Israel.

verses.text: But the name of Hebron was formerly Kirjath Arba, the capital of the Anakim.
parts: But the name of Hebron was formerly Kirjath Arba, the capital of the Anakim.

verses.text: So this was the lot of the tribe of the children of Judah according to their families: The border of Edom at the Desert of Zin southward was the extreme southern boundary.
parts: So this was the lot of the tribe of the children of Judah according to their families: The border of Edom at the Desert of Zin southward was the extreme southern boundary.

verses.text: Their southern border began at the shore of the Salt Sea, from the bay that faces southward.
parts: Their southern border began at the shore of the Salt Sea, from the bay that faces southward.

verses.text: Then it went out to the southern side of the Ascent of Akrabbim, passed along to Zin, ascended on the south side of Kadesh Barnea, passed along to Hezron, went up to Adar, and went around to Karkaa.
parts: Then it went out to the southern side of the Ascent of Akrabbim, passed along to Zin, ascended on the south side of Kadesh Barnea, passed along to Hezron, went up to Adar, and went around to Karkaa.

verses.text: From there it passed toward Azmon and went out to the Brook of Egypt; and the border ended at the sea.
parts: From there it passed toward Azmon and went out to the Brook of Egypt; and the border ended at the sea.

verses.text: The east border was the Salt Sea as far as the mouth of the Jordan, and the border on the northern quarter began at the bay of the sea at the mouth of the Jordan.
parts: The east border was the Salt Sea as far as the mouth of the Jordan, and the border on the northern quarter began at the bay of the sea at the mouth of the Jordan.

verses.text: The border went up to Beth Hoglah and passed north of Beth Arabah; and the border went up to the stone of Bohan the son of Reuben.
parts: The border went up to Beth Hoglah and passed north of Beth Arabah; and the border went up to the stone of Bohan the son of Reuben.

verses.text: Then the border went up toward Debir from the Valley of Achor, and it turned northward toward Gilgal, which is before the Ascent of Adummim, which is on the south side of the valley.
parts: Then the border went up toward Debir from the Valley of Achor, and it turned northward toward Gilgal, which is before the Ascent of Adummim, which is on the south side of the valley.

verses.text: The border went up by the Valley of the Son of Hinnom to the southern slope of the Jebusite city (which is Jerusalem).
parts: The border went up by the Valley of the Son of Hinnom to the southern slope of the Jebusite city (which is Jerusalem).

verses.text: Then the border went around from the top of the hill to the fountain of the water of Nephtoah, and extended to the cities of Mount Ephron.
parts: Then the border went around from the top of the hill to the fountain of the water of Nephtoah, and extended to the cities of Mount Ephron.

verses.text: Then the border turned from Baalah to Mount Seir, passed along to the side of Mount Jearim on the north (which is Chesalon), went down to Beth Shemesh, and passed on to Timnah.
parts: Then the border turned from Baalah to Mount Seir, passed along to the side of Mount Jearim on the north (which is Chesalon), went down to Beth Shemesh, and passed on to Timnah.

verses.text: The border went out to the side of Ekron northward.
parts: The border went out to the side of Ekron northward.

verses.text: The west border was the coastline of the Great Sea.
parts: The west border was the coastline of the Great Sea.

verses.text: Now to Caleb the son of Jephunneh he gave a share among the children of Judah, according to the commandment of the Lord to Joshua, namely, Kirjath Arba, which is Hebron (Arba was the father of Anak). Caleb drove out the three sons of Anak from there: Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai, the children of Anak.
parts: Now to Caleb the son of Jephunneh he gave a share among the children of Judah, according to the commandment of the Lord to Joshua, namely, Kirjath Arba, which is Hebron (Arba was the father of Anak).
Caleb drove out the three sons of Anak from there: Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai, the children of Anak.

verses.text: Caleb drove out the three sons of Anak from there: Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai, the children of Anak.
parts: Caleb drove out the three sons of Anak from there: Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai, the children of Anak.

verses.text: Then he went up from there to the inhabitants of Debir (formerly the name of Debir was Kirjath Sepher).
parts: Then he went up from there to the inhabitants of Debir (formerly the name of Debir was Kirjath Sepher).

verses.text: Then Caleb said, “He who attacks Kirjath Sepher and takes it, to him I will give Achsah my daughter as wife.”
parts: Then Caleb said, “He who attacks Kirjath Sepher and takes it, to him I will give Achsah my daughter as wife.”

verses.text: So Othniel the son of Kenez, the younger brother of Caleb, took it, and he gave him Achsah his daughter as wife.
parts: So Othniel the son of Kenez, the younger brother of Caleb, took it, and he gave him Achsah his daughter as wife.

verses.text: Now it was so, when she came to him, that she persuaded him to ask her father for a field.
parts: Now it was so, when she came to him, that she persuaded him to ask her father for a field.

verses.text: She answered, “Give me a blessing; since you have given me land in the South, give me also springs of water.” So he gave her the upper spring and the lower springs.
parts: She answered, “Give me a blessing; since you have given me land in the South, give me also springs of water.” So he gave her the upper spring and the lower springs.

verses.text: This was the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Judah according to their families.
parts: This was the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Judah according to their families.

verses.text: The cities at the limits of the tribe of the children of Judah, toward the border of Edom in the South, were Kabzeel, Eder, Jagur,
parts: The cities at the limits of the tribe of the children of Judah, toward the border of Edom in the South, were Kabzeel, Eder, Jagur,

verses.text: Kinah, Dimonah, Adadah,
parts: Kinah, Dimonah, Adadah,

verses.text: Kedesh, Hazor, Ithnan,
parts: Kedesh, Hazor, Ithnan,

verses.text: Ziph, Telem, Bealoth,
parts: Ziph, Telem, Bealoth,

verses.text: Hazor, Hadattah, Kerioth, Hezron (which is Hazor),
parts: Hazor, Hadattah, Kerioth, Hezron (which is Hazor),

verses.text: Amam, Shema, Moladah,
parts: Amam, Shema, Moladah,

verses.text: Hazar Gaddah, Heshmon, Beth Pelet,
parts: Hazar Gaddah, Heshmon, Beth Pelet,

verses.text: Hazar, Shual, Beersheba, Bizjothjah,
parts: Hazar, Shual, Beersheba, Bizjothjah,

verses.text: Baalah, Ijim, Ezem,
parts: Baalah, Ijim, Ezem,

verses.text: Eltolad, Chesil, Hormah,
parts: Eltolad, Chesil, Hormah,

verses.text: Ziklag, Madmannah, Sansannah,
parts: Ziklag, Madmannah, Sansannah,

verses.text: Lebaoth, Shilhim, Ain, and Rimmon: twenty-nine cities with their villages.
parts: Lebaoth, Shilhim, Ain, and Rimmon: twenty-nine cities with their villages.

verses.text: In the lowland: Eshtaol, Zorah, Ashnah, Zanoah, En Gannim, Tappuah, Enam, Jarmuth, Adullam, Socoh, Azekah, Sharaim, Adithaim, Gederah, and Gederothaim: fourteen cities with their villages; Zenan, Hadashah, Migdal Gad, Dilean, Mizpah, Joktheel, Lachish, Bozkath, Eglon, Cabbon, Lahmas, Kithlish, Gederoth, Beth Dagon, Naamah, and Makkedah: sixteen cities with their villages; Libnah, Ether, Ashan, Jiphtah, Ashnah, Nezib, Keilah, Achzib, and Mareshah: nine cities with their villages; Ekron, with its towns and villages; from Ekron to the sea, all that lay near Ashdod, with their villages; Ashdod with its towns and villages, Gaza with its town and villages—as far as the Brook of Egypt and the Great Sea with its coastline.
parts: In the lowland: Eshtaol, Zorah, Ashnah, Zanoah, En Gannim, Tappuah, Enam, Jarmuth, Adullam, Socoh, Azekah, Sharaim, Adithaim, Gederah, and Gederothaim: fourteen cities with their villages; Zenan, Hadashah, Migdal Gad, Dilean, Mizpah, Joktheel, Lachish, Bozkath, Eglon, Cabbon, Lahmas, Kithlish, Gederoth, Beth Dagon, Naamah, and Makkedah: sixteen cities with their villages; Libnah, Ether, Ashan, Jiphtah, Ashnah, Nezib, Keilah, Achzib, and Mareshah: nine cities with their villages; Ekron, with its towns and villages; from Ekron to the sea, all that lay near Ashdod, with their villages; Ashdod with its towns and villages, Gaza with its town and villages—as far as the Brook of Egypt and the Great Sea with its coastline.
