verses.text: In the mountain country: Shamir, Jattir, Sochoh, Dannah, Kirjath Sannah (which is Debir), Anab, Eshtemoh, Anim, Goshen, Holon, and Giloh: eleven cities with their villages; Arab, Dumah, Eshean, Janum, Beth Tappuah, Aphekah, Humtah, Kirjath Arba (which is Hebron), and Zior: nine cities with their villages; Maon, Carmel, Ziph, Juttah, Jezreel, Jokdeam, Zanoah, Kain, Gibeah, and Timnah: ten cities with their villages; Halhul, Beth Zur, Gedor, Maarath, Beth Anoth, and Eltekon: six cities with their villages; Theco and Ephratha (which is Bethlehem), and Phagor and Aetan and Culon and Tatam and Thobes and Carem and Galem and Thether and Manocho: eleven cities and their villages; Kirjath Baal (which is Kirjath Jearim) and Rabbah: two cities with their villages.

verses.text: Nibshan, the City of Salt, and En Gedi: six cities with their villages.
parts: Nibshan, the City of Salt, and En Gedi: six cities with their villages.

verses.text: As for the Jebusites who dwelled in Jerusalem, the sons of Judah were not able to destroy them.
parts: As for the Jebusites who dwelled in Jerusalem, the sons of Judah were not able to destroy them.

verses.text: The lot fell to the children of Joseph from the Jordan, by Jericho, to the waters of Jericho on the east, to the desert that goes up from Jericho through the mountains to Bethel, then went out from Bethel to Luz, passed along to the border of the Archites at Ataroth, and went down westward to the boundary of the Japhletites, as far as the boundary of Lower Beth Horon to Gezer; and it ended at the sea.
parts: The lot fell to the children of Joseph from the Jordan, by Jericho, to the waters of Jericho on the east, to the desert that goes up from Jericho through the mountains to Bethel, then went out from Bethel to Luz, passed along to the border of the Archites at Ataroth, and went down westward to the boundary of the Japhletites, as far as the boundary of Lower Beth Horon to Gezer; and it ended at the sea.

verses.text: So the children of Joseph, Manasseh and Ephraim, took their inheritance.
parts: So the children of Joseph, Manasseh and Ephraim, took their inheritance.

verses.text: The border of the children of Ephraim, according to their families, was thus: The border of their inheritance on the east side was Ataroth Addar as far as Upper Beth Horon.
parts: The border of the children of Ephraim, according to their families, was thus: The border of their inheritance on the east side was Ataroth Addar as far as Upper Beth Horon.

verses.text: The border went out toward the sea on the north side of Michmethath; then the border went around eastward to Taanath Shiloh, and passed by it on the east of Janohah.
parts: The border went out toward the sea on the north side of Michmethath; then the border went around eastward to Taanath Shiloh, and passed by it on the east of Janohah.

verses.text: Then it went down from Janohah to Ataroth and Naarah, reached to Jericho, and came out at the Jordan.
parts: Then it went down from Janohah to Ataroth and Naarah, reached to Jericho, and came out at the Jordan.

verses.text: The border went out from Tappuah westward to the Brook Kanah, and it ended at the sea.
parts: The border went out from Tappuah westward to the Brook Kanah, and it ended at the sea.

verses.text: The separate cities for the children of Ephraim were among the inheritance of the children of Manasseh, all the cities with their villages.
parts: The separate cities for the children of Ephraim were among the inheritance of the children of Manasseh, all the cities with their villages.

verses.text: But Ephraim did not destroy the Canaanites who dwelt in Gezer, and the Canaanites dwell among Ephraim to this day, until Pharaoh the king of the Egyptians came and took it and burned it with fire.
parts: But Ephraim did not destroy the Canaanites who dwelt in Gezer, and the Canaanites dwell among Ephraim to this day, until Pharaoh the king of the Egyptians came and took it and burned it with fire.

verses.text: There was also a lot for the tribe of Manasseh, for he was the firstborn of Joseph: namely for Machir the firstborn of Manasseh, the father of Gilead, because he was a man of war; therefore, he was given Gilead and Bashan.
parts: There was also a lot for the tribe of Manasseh, for he was the firstborn of Joseph: namely for Machir the firstborn of Manasseh, the father of Gilead, because he was a man of war; therefore, he was given Gilead and Bashan.

verses.text: There was also a lot for the rest of the children of Manasseh according to their families; for the children of Abiezer, the children of Helek, the children of Asriel, the children of Shechem, the children of Hepher, and the children of Shemida; these were the male children of Manasseh the son of Joseph according to their families.
parts: There was also a lot for the rest of the children of Manasseh according to their families; for the children of Abiezer, the children of Helek, the children of Asriel, the children of Shechem, the children of Hepher, and the children of Shemida; these were the male children of Manasseh the son of Joseph according to their families.

verses.text: But Zelophehad the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, had no sons, but only daughters.
parts: But Zelophehad the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, had no sons, but only daughters.

verses.text: They came near before Eleazar the priest, before Joshua the son of Nun, and before the rulers, saying, “The Lord commanded Moses to give us an inheritance among our brothers.” Therefore, according to the commandment of the Lord, he gave them an inheritance among their father's brothers.
parts: They came near before Eleazar the priest, before Joshua the son of Nun, and before the rulers, saying, “The Lord commanded Moses to give us an inheritance among our brothers.” Therefore, according to the commandment of the Lord, he gave them an inheritance among their father's brothers.

verses.text: Ten shares fell to Manasseh, besides the land of Gilead and Bashan, which were on the other side of the Jordan,
parts: Ten shares fell to Manasseh, besides the land of Gilead and Bashan, which were on the other side of the Jordan,

verses.text: because the daughters of Manasseh received an inheritance among his sons; and the rest of Manasseh's sons had the land of Gilead.
parts: because the daughters of Manasseh received an inheritance among his sons; and the rest of Manasseh's sons had the land of Gilead.

verses.text: Now the territory of Manasseh was from Asher to Michmethath, which lies east of Shechem; and the border went along south to the inhabitants of En Tappuah.
parts: Now the territory of Manasseh was from Asher to Michmethath, which lies east of Shechem; and the border went along south to the inhabitants of En Tappuah.

verses.text: Manasseh had the land of Tappuah, but Tappuah on the border of Manasseh belonged to the children of Ephraim.
parts: Manasseh had the land of Tappuah, but Tappuah on the border of Manasseh belonged to the children of Ephraim.

verses.text: The border descended to the Brook Kanah, southward to the brook.
parts: The border descended to the Brook Kanah, southward to the brook.

verses.text: Southward it was Ephraim's, northward it was Manasseh's, and the sea was its border.
parts: Southward it was Ephraim's, northward it was Manasseh's, and the sea was its border.

verses.text: In Issachar and in Asher, Manasseh had Beth Shean and its towns, Ibleam and its towns, the inhabitants of Dor and its towns, the inhabitants of En Dor and its towns, the inhabitants of Taanach and its towns, and the inhabitants of Megiddo and its towns—three hilly regions.
parts: In Issachar and in Asher, Manasseh had Beth Shean and its towns, Ibleam and its towns, the inhabitants of Dor and its towns, the inhabitants of En Dor and its towns, the inhabitants of Taanach and its towns, and the inhabitants of Megiddo and its towns—three hilly regions.

verses.text: Now the sons of Manasseh were not able to destroy these cities completely.
parts: Now the sons of Manasseh were not able to destroy these cities completely.

verses.text: Thus when the sons of Israel grew strong, they subjected the Canaanites, but did not utterly destroy them.
parts: Thus when the sons of Israel grew strong, they subjected the Canaanites, but did not utterly destroy them.

verses.text: Then the sons of Joseph spoke to Joshua, saying, “Why did you give us only one lot and one share to inherit?
parts: Then the sons of Joseph spoke to Joshua, saying, “Why did you give us only one lot and one share to inherit?

verses.text: So Joshua answered them, “If you are a great people, then go up to the forest country and clear a place for yourself there in the land of the Perizzites and the giants, since the mountains of Ephraim are too confined for you.”
parts: So Joshua answered them, “If you are a great people, then go up to the forest country and clear a place for yourself there in the land of the Perizzites and the giants, since the mountains of Ephraim are too confined for you.”

verses.text: But the children of Joseph said, “The mountain country is not enough for us; and all the Canaanites who dwell in the land of the valley have chariots of iron, both those of Beth Shean and its towns and of the Valley of Jezreel.”
parts: But the children of Joseph said, “The mountain country is not enough for us; and all the Canaanites who dwell in the land of the valley have chariots of iron, both those of Beth Shean and its towns and of the Valley of Jezreel.”

verses.text: Then Joshua spoke to the house of Joseph—to Ephraim and Manasseh—saying, “You are a great people, and have great power.
parts: Then Joshua spoke to the house of Joseph—to Ephraim and Manasseh—saying, “You are a great people, and have great power.

verses.text: but the mountain country shall be yours.
parts: but the mountain country shall be yours.

verses.text: Now the whole congregation of the children of Israel assembled together at Shiloh and set up the tabernacle of testimony there; and they subdued the land. But there remained among the children of Israel seven tribes which had not yet received their inheritance.
parts: Now the whole congregation of the children of Israel assembled together at Shiloh and set up the tabernacle of testimony there; and they subdued the land.
But there remained among the children of Israel seven tribes which had not yet received their inheritance.

verses.text: Then Joshua said to the children of Israel, “How long will you neglect to go and possess the land which the Lord God of your fathers has given you?
parts: Then Joshua said to the children of Israel, “How long will you neglect to go and possess the land which the Lord God of your fathers has given you?

verses.text: Pick out from among you three men for each tribe, and I will send them.
parts: Pick out from among you three men for each tribe, and I will send them.

verses.text: They shall divide it into seven parts.
parts: They shall divide it into seven parts.

verses.text: You shall therefore survey the land in seven parts, and bring the survey here to me, that I may cast lots for you here before the Lord our God.
parts: You shall therefore survey the land in seven parts, and bring the survey here to me, that I may cast lots for you here before the Lord our God.

verses.text: But the Levites have no part among you, for the priesthood of the Lord is their inheritance; and Gad, Reuben, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance beyond the Jordan on the east, which Moses the servant of the Lord gave them.”
parts: But the Levites have no part among you, for the priesthood of the Lord is their inheritance; and Gad, Reuben, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance beyond the Jordan on the east, which Moses the servant of the Lord gave them.”

verses.text: Then the men arose to go away, and Joshua charged those who went to survey the land, saying, “Go, walk through the land, survey it, and come back to me, that I may cast lots for you here before the Lord in Shiloh.” So the men went, passed through the land, and wrote the survey in a book in seven parts by cities; and they came to Joshua at the camp in Shiloh.
parts: Then the men arose to go away, and Joshua charged those who went to survey the land, saying, “Go, walk through the land, survey it, and come back to me, that I may cast lots for you here before the Lord in Shiloh.” So the men went, passed through the land, and wrote the survey in a book in seven parts by cities; and they came to Joshua at the camp in Shiloh.

verses.text: So the men went, passed through the land, and wrote the survey in a book in seven parts by cities; and they came to Joshua at the camp in Shiloh.
parts: So the men went, passed through the land, and wrote the survey in a book in seven parts by cities; and they came to Joshua at the camp in Shiloh.

verses.text: Then Joshua cast lots for them in Shiloh before the Lord, and there Joshua divided the land to the children of Israel according to their divisions.
parts: Then Joshua cast lots for them in Shiloh before the Lord, and there Joshua divided the land to the children of Israel according to their divisions.

verses.text: Now the lot of the tribe of the children of Benjamin came up according to their families, and the territory of their lot came out between the children of Judah and the children of Joseph.
parts: Now the lot of the tribe of the children of Benjamin came up according to their families, and the territory of their lot came out between the children of Judah and the children of Joseph.

verses.text: Their border on the north side began at the Jordan, and the border went up to the side of Jericho on the north, and went up through the mountains westward; it ended at the Desert of Beth Aven.
parts: Their border on the north side began at the Jordan, and the border went up to the side of Jericho on the north, and went up through the mountains westward; it ended at the Desert of Beth Aven.

verses.text: The border went over from there toward Luz, to the side of Luz (which is Bethel) southward; and the border descended to Ataroth Addar, near the hill that lies on the south side of Lower Beth Horon.
parts: The border went over from there toward Luz, to the side of Luz (which is Bethel) southward; and the border descended to Ataroth Addar, near the hill that lies on the south side of Lower Beth Horon.

verses.text: Then the border extended around the west side to the south, from the hill that lies before Beth Horon southward, and it ended at Kirjath Baal (which is Kirjath Jearim), a city of the children of Judah.
parts: Then the border extended around the west side to the south, from the hill that lies before Beth Horon southward, and it ended at Kirjath Baal (which is Kirjath Jearim), a city of the children of Judah.

verses.text: The south side began at the end of Kirjath Jearim, and the border extended on the west and went out to the spring of the waters of Jephtoah.
parts: The south side began at the end of Kirjath Jearim, and the border extended on the west and went out to the spring of the waters of Jephtoah.

verses.text: Then the border came down to the end of the mountain that lies before the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, which is in the Valley of the Rephaim on the north, descended to the Valley of Hinnom, to the side of the Jebusite city on the south, and descended to En Rogel.
parts: Then the border came down to the end of the mountain that lies before the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, which is in the Valley of the Rephaim on the north, descended to the Valley of Hinnom, to the side of the Jebusite city on the south, and descended to En Rogel.

verses.text: It went around from the north, went out to En Shemesh, and extended toward Geliloth, which is before the Ascent of Adummim, and descended to the stone of Bohan the son of Reuben.
parts: It went around from the north, went out to En Shemesh, and extended toward Geliloth, which is before the Ascent of Adummim, and descended to the stone of Bohan the son of Reuben.

verses.text: Then it passed along toward the north side of Arabah, and went down to Arabah.
parts: Then it passed along toward the north side of Arabah, and went down to Arabah.

verses.text: The border passed along to the north side of Beth Hoglah; then the border ended at the north bay at the Salt Sea, at the south end of the Jordan.
parts: The border passed along to the north side of Beth Hoglah; then the border ended at the north bay at the Salt Sea, at the south end of the Jordan.

verses.text: The Jordan was its border on the east side.
parts: The Jordan was its border on the east side.

verses.text: Now the cities of the tribe of the children of Benjamin, according to their families, were Jericho, Beth Hoglah, Emek Keziz, Beth Arabah, Zemaraim, Bethel, Avim, Parah, Ophrah, Chephar Haammoni, Ophni, and Gaba: twelve cities with their villages; Gibeon, Ramah, Beeroth, Mizpah, Chephirah, Mozah, Rekem, Irpeel, Taralah, Zelah, Eleph, Jebus (which is Jerusalem), Gibeath, and Kirjath, fourteen cities with their villages.
parts: Now the cities of the tribe of the children of Benjamin, according to their families, were Jericho, Beth Hoglah, Emek Keziz, Beth Arabah, Zemaraim, Bethel, Avim, Parah, Ophrah, Chephar Haammoni, Ophni, and Gaba: twelve cities with their villages; Gibeon, Ramah, Beeroth, Mizpah, Chephirah, Mozah, Rekem, Irpeel, Taralah, Zelah, Eleph, Jebus (which is Jerusalem), Gibeath, and Kirjath, fourteen cities with their villages.

verses.text: Beth Arabah, Zemaraim, Bethel,
parts: Beth Arabah, Zemaraim, Bethel,

verses.text: Avim, Parah, Ophrah,
parts: Avim, Parah, Ophrah,

verses.text: Chephar Haammoni, Ophni, and Gaba: twelve cities with their villages;
parts: Chephar Haammoni, Ophni, and Gaba: twelve cities with their villages;

verses.text: Gibeon, Ramah, Beeroth,
parts: Gibeon, Ramah, Beeroth,

verses.text: Mizpah, Chephirah, Mozah,
parts: Mizpah, Chephirah, Mozah,

verses.text: Rekem, Irpeel, Taralah,
parts: Rekem, Irpeel, Taralah,

verses.text: Zelah, Eleph, Jebus (which is Jerusalem), Gibeath, and Kirjath, fourteen cities with their villages.
parts: Zelah, Eleph, Jebus (which is Jerusalem), Gibeath, and Kirjath, fourteen cities with their villages.

verses.text: The second lot came out for Simeon, for the tribe of the children of Simeon according to their families.
parts: The second lot came out for Simeon, for the tribe of the children of Simeon according to their families.

verses.text: They had in their inheritance Beersheba (Sheba), Moladah,
parts: They had in their inheritance Beersheba (Sheba), Moladah,

verses.text: Hazar Shual, Balah, Ezem,
parts: Hazar Shual, Balah, Ezem,

verses.text: Eltolad, Bethul, Hormah,
parts: Eltolad, Bethul, Hormah,

verses.text: Ziklag, Beth Marcaboth, Hazar Susah,
parts: Ziklag, Beth Marcaboth, Hazar Susah,

verses.text: Beth Lebaoth, and Sharuhen: thirteen cities and their villages;
parts: Beth Lebaoth, and Sharuhen: thirteen cities and their villages;

verses.text: Ain, Rimmon, Ether, and Ashan: four cities and their villages;
parts: Ain, Rimmon, Ether, and Ashan: four cities and their villages;

verses.text: and all the villages around these cities as far as Baalath Beer, Ramah of the South.
parts: and all the villages around these cities as far as Baalath Beer, Ramah of the South.

verses.text: The inheritance of the children of Simeon was included in the share of the children of Judah, for the share of the children of Judah was too much for them.
parts: The inheritance of the children of Simeon was included in the share of the children of Judah, for the share of the children of Judah was too much for them.

verses.text: The third lot came out for the children of Zebulun according to their families, and the border of their inheritance was as far as Sarid.
parts: The third lot came out for the children of Zebulun according to their families, and the border of their inheritance was as far as Sarid.

verses.text: Their border went toward the west and to Maralah, went to Dabbasheth, and extended along the brook east of Jokneam.
parts: Their border went toward the west and to Maralah, went to Dabbasheth, and extended along the brook east of Jokneam.

verses.text: Then from Sarid it went eastward toward the sunrise along the border of Chisloth Tabor, and went out toward Daberath, bypassing Japhia.
parts: Then from Sarid it went eastward toward the sunrise along the border of Chisloth Tabor, and went out toward Daberath, bypassing Japhia.

verses.text: From there it passes along on the east of Gath Hepher, toward Eth Kazin, and extended to Rimmon, which borders on Neah.
parts: From there it passes along on the east of Gath Hepher, toward Eth Kazin, and extended to Rimmon, which borders on Neah.

verses.text: Then the border went around it on the north side of Hannathon, and it ended in the Valley of Jiphthah El.
parts: Then the border went around it on the north side of Hannathon, and it ended in the Valley of Jiphthah El.

verses.text: Included were Kattath, Nahallal, Shimron, Idalah, and Bethlehem: twelve cities with their villages.
parts: Included were Kattath, Nahallal, Shimron, Idalah, and Bethlehem: twelve cities with their villages.

verses.text: This was the inheritance of the children of Zebulun according to their families, these cities with their villages.
parts: This was the inheritance of the children of Zebulun according to their families, these cities with their villages.

verses.text: The fourth lot came out to Issachar, for the children of Issachar according to their families.
parts: The fourth lot came out to Issachar, for the children of Issachar according to their families.

verses.text: Their territory went to Jezreel, and included Chesulloth, Shunem,
parts: Their territory went to Jezreel, and included Chesulloth, Shunem,

verses.text: Haphraim, Shion, Anaharath,
parts: Haphraim, Shion, Anaharath,

verses.text: Rabbith, Kishion, Abez,
parts: Rabbith, Kishion, Abez,

verses.text: Remeth, En Gannim, En Haddah, and Beth Pazzez.
parts: Remeth, En Gannim, En Haddah, and Beth Pazzez.

verses.text: The border reached to Tabor, Shahazimah, and Beth Shemesh; their border ended at the Jordan: sixteen cities with their villages.
parts: The border reached to Tabor, Shahazimah, and Beth Shemesh; their border ended at the Jordan: sixteen cities with their villages.

verses.text: This was the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Issachar according to their families, the cities and their villages.
parts: This was the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Issachar according to their families, the cities and their villages.

verses.text: The fifth lot came out for the tribe of the children of Asher according to their families.
parts: The fifth lot came out for the tribe of the children of Asher according to their families.

verses.text: Their territory included Helkath, Hali, Beten, Achshaph,
parts: Their territory included Helkath, Hali, Beten, Achshaph,

verses.text: Alammelech, Amad, and Mishal; it reached to Mount Carmel westward, along the Brook Shihor Libnath.
parts: Alammelech, Amad, and Mishal; it reached to Mount Carmel westward, along the Brook Shihor Libnath.

verses.text: It turned toward the sunrise to Beth Dagon; and reached to Zebulun and to the Valley of Jiphthah El, then northward beyond Beth Emek and Neiel, bypassing Cabul on the left,
parts: It turned toward the sunrise to Beth Dagon; and reached to Zebulun and to the Valley of Jiphthah El, then northward beyond Beth Emek and Neiel, bypassing Cabul on the left,

verses.text: including Ebron, Rehob, Hammon, and Kanah, as far as Greater Sidon.
parts: including Ebron, Rehob, Hammon, and Kanah, as far as Greater Sidon.

verses.text: The border turned to Ramah and to the fortified city of Tyre; then to Hosah, and ended at the sea by the region of Achzib.
parts: The border turned to Ramah and to the fortified city of Tyre; then to Hosah, and ended at the sea by the region of Achzib.

verses.text: Also Ummah, Aphek, and Rehob were included: twenty-two cities with their villages.
parts: Also Ummah, Aphek, and Rehob were included: twenty-two cities with their villages.

verses.text: This was the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Asher according to their families, the cities and their villages.
parts: This was the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Asher according to their families, the cities and their villages.

verses.text: The sixth lot came out to the children of Naphtali, for the children of Naphtali according to their families.
parts: The sixth lot came out to the children of Naphtali, for the children of Naphtali according to their families.

verses.text: Their border began at Heleph, enclosing the territory from the terebinth tree in Zaananim, Adami Nekeb, and Jabneel, as far as Lakkum; it ended at the Jordan.
parts: Their border began at Heleph, enclosing the territory from the terebinth tree in Zaananim, Adami Nekeb, and Jabneel, as far as Lakkum; it ended at the Jordan.

verses.text: From Heleph the border extended westward to Aznoth Tabor, and went out from there toward Hukkok; it adjoined Zebulun on the south side and Asher on the west side, and ended at Judah by the Jordan toward the sunrise.
parts: From Heleph the border extended westward to Aznoth Tabor, and went out from there toward Hukkok; it adjoined Zebulun on the south side and Asher on the west side, and ended at Judah by the Jordan toward the sunrise.

verses.text: The fortified cities are Ziddim, Zer, Hammath, Rakkath, Chinnereth,
parts: The fortified cities are Ziddim, Zer, Hammath, Rakkath, Chinnereth,

verses.text: Adamah, Ramah, Hazor,
parts: Adamah, Ramah, Hazor,

verses.text: Kedesh, Edrei, En Hazor,
parts: Kedesh, Edrei, En Hazor,

verses.text: Iron, Migdal El, Horem, Beth Anath, and Beth Shemesh: nineteen cities with their villages.
parts: Iron, Migdal El, Horem, Beth Anath, and Beth Shemesh: nineteen cities with their villages.

verses.text: This was the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Naphtali according to their families, the cities and their villages.
parts: This was the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Naphtali according to their families, the cities and their villages.

verses.text: The seventh lot came out for the tribe of the children of Dan according to their families.
parts: The seventh lot came out for the tribe of the children of Dan according to their families.

verses.text: The territory of their inheritance was Zorah, Eshtaol, Ir Shemesh,
parts: The territory of their inheritance was Zorah, Eshtaol, Ir Shemesh,

verses.text: Shaalabbin, Aijalon, Jethlah,
parts: Shaalabbin, Aijalon, Jethlah,

verses.text: Elon, Timnah, Ekron,
parts: Elon, Timnah, Ekron,

verses.text: Eltekeh, Gibbethon, Baalath,
parts: Eltekeh, Gibbethon, Baalath,

verses.text: Jehud, Bene Berak, Gath Rimmon,
parts: Jehud, Bene Berak, Gath Rimmon,

verses.text: Me Jarkon, and Rakkon, with the region near Joppa.
parts: Me Jarkon, and Rakkon, with the region near Joppa.

verses.text: The border of the children of Dan went beyond these, because the children of Dan went up to fight against Leshem and took it; and they struck it with the edge of the sword, took possession of it, and dwelt in it.
parts: The border of the children of Dan went beyond these, because the children of Dan went up to fight against Leshem and took it; and they struck it with the edge of the sword, took possession of it, and dwelt in it.

verses.text: This was the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Dan according to their families, the cities and their villages.
parts: This was the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Dan according to their families, the cities and their villages.

verses.text: But the sons of Dan did not press the Amorites who afflicted them in the mountain; and the Amorites did not permit them to descend into the valley, but forcibly took from them the border of their possession.
parts: But the sons of Dan did not press the Amorites who afflicted them in the mountain; and the Amorites did not permit them to descend into the valley, but forcibly took from them the border of their possession.

verses.text: Now the sons of Judah marched and fought Lachish and laid hold of it.
parts: Now the sons of Judah marched and fought Lachish and laid hold of it.

verses.text: Now the Amorites continued to dwell in Elom and in Salamin; but the hand of Ephraim prevailed against them, and they paid tribute to them.
parts: Now the Amorites continued to dwell in Elom and in Salamin; but the hand of Ephraim prevailed against them, and they paid tribute to them.

verses.text: So they proceeded to take possession of the land according to their borders, and the children of Israel gave an inheritance to Joshua the son of Nun among them, according to the ordinance of God.
parts: So they proceeded to take possession of the land according to their borders, and the children of Israel gave an inheritance to Joshua the son of Nun among them, according to the ordinance of God.

verses.text: They gave him the city he asked for, Timnath Serah, in the mountains of Ephraim.
parts: They gave him the city he asked for, Timnath Serah, in the mountains of Ephraim.

verses.text: These were the inheritances which Eleazar the priest, Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers of the tribes of the children of Israel divided as an inheritance by lot in Shiloh before the Lord, at the door of the tabernacle of testimony.
parts: These were the inheritances which Eleazar the priest, Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers of the tribes of the children of Israel divided as an inheritance by lot in Shiloh before the Lord, at the door of the tabernacle of testimony.

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Joshua, saying, “Say to the sons of Israel, ‘Appoint the cities of refuge of which I spoke to you through Moses, a place of refuge for a slayer who kills a soul involuntarily.
parts: Then the Lord spoke to Joshua, saying,
“Say to the sons of Israel, ‘Appoint the cities of refuge of which I spoke to you through Moses, a place of refuge for a slayer who kills a soul involuntarily.

verses.text: So he appointed Kedesh in Galilee in the mountains of Naphtali, Shechem in the mountains of Ephraim, and Kirjath Arba (which is Hebron) in the mountains of Judah.
parts: So he appointed Kedesh in Galilee in the mountains of Naphtali, Shechem in the mountains of Ephraim, and Kirjath Arba (which is Hebron) in the mountains of Judah.

verses.text: On the other side of the Jordan he appointed Bezer in the desert on the plain from the tribe of Reuben, and Ramoth in Gilead from the tribe of Gad, and Golan in Bashan from the tribe of Manasseh.
parts: On the other side of the Jordan he appointed Bezer in the desert on the plain from the tribe of Reuben, and Ramoth in Gilead from the tribe of Gad, and Golan in Bashan from the tribe of Manasseh.

verses.text: These were the cities appointed for the children of Israel and for the resident alien living among them, that whoever killed a soul involuntarily should take refuge there, and not die by the hand of the avenger of blood until he stood before the congregation for judgment.
parts: These were the cities appointed for the children of Israel and for the resident alien living among them, that whoever killed a soul involuntarily should take refuge there, and not die by the hand of the avenger of blood until he stood before the congregation for judgment.

verses.text: Now the heads of the fathers of the sons of Levi came to Eleazar the priest, to Joshua the son of Nun, and to the chiefs of the tribes of the fathers from the tribes of Israel, and spoke to them in Shiloh in the land of Canaan, saying, “The Lord commanded through the hand of Moses that we be given cities to dwell in, with the common-lands for our cattle.” So the children of Israel gave the Levites a portion of their inheritance at the command of the Lord, cities and their common-lands.
parts: Now the heads of the fathers of the sons of Levi came to Eleazar the priest, to Joshua the son of Nun, and to the chiefs of the tribes of the fathers from the tribes of Israel, and spoke to them in Shiloh in the land of Canaan, saying, “The Lord commanded through the hand of Moses that we be given cities to dwell in, with the common-lands for our cattle.” So the children of Israel gave the Levites a portion of their inheritance at the command of the Lord, cities and their common-lands.

verses.text: Now the lot came out for the family of the Kohathites, and from the tribe of Judah, the tribe of Simeon, and the tribe of Benjamin, there were thirteen cities given by lot to the sons of Aaron, who were priests among the Levites.
parts: Now the lot came out for the family of the Kohathites, and from the tribe of Judah, the tribe of Simeon, and the tribe of Benjamin, there were thirteen cities given by lot to the sons of Aaron, who were priests among the Levites.

verses.text: For the remaining sons of Kohath, ten cities were chosen by lot from the tribe of Ephraim, the tribe of Dan, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
parts: For the remaining sons of Kohath, ten cities were chosen by lot from the tribe of Ephraim, the tribe of Dan, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.

verses.text: For the sons of Gershon, there were thirteen cities by lot from the tribe of Issachar, the tribe of Asher, the tribe of Naphtali, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in Bashan.
parts: For the sons of Gershon, there were thirteen cities by lot from the tribe of Issachar, the tribe of Asher, the tribe of Naphtali, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in Bashan.

verses.text: For the sons of Merari according to their families, there were twelve cities by lot from the tribe of Reuben, the tribe of Gad, and the tribe of Zebulun.
parts: For the sons of Merari according to their families, there were twelve cities by lot from the tribe of Reuben, the tribe of Gad, and the tribe of Zebulun.

verses.text: So the children of Israel gave the Levites cities and their common-lands by lot, as the Lord commanded Moses.
parts: So the children of Israel gave the Levites cities and their common-lands by lot, as the Lord commanded Moses.

verses.text: From the tribe of the sons of Judah, and the tribe of the sons of Simeon, and the tribe of the sons of Benjamin, they gave the cities, designated by name,
parts: From the tribe of the sons of Judah, and the tribe of the sons of Simeon, and the tribe of the sons of Benjamin, they gave the cities, designated by name,

verses.text: to the sons of Aaron from the family of Kohath, who were of the sons of Levi, because the lot was theirs.
parts: to the sons of Aaron from the family of Kohath, who were of the sons of Levi, because the lot was theirs.

verses.text: They gave them Kirjath Arba, the capital of the sons of Anak (which is Hebron), in the mountains of Judah, with the common-land surrounding it.
parts: They gave them Kirjath Arba, the capital of the sons of Anak (which is Hebron), in the mountains of Judah, with the common-land surrounding it.

verses.text: But the fields of the city and its villages Joshua gave to the sons of Caleb, the son of Jephunneh, as their possession.
parts: But the fields of the city and its villages Joshua gave to the sons of Caleb, the son of Jephunneh, as their possession.

verses.text: Thus to the sons of Aaron they gave Hebron with its common-land (a city of refuge for the slayer), Libna with its common-land,
parts: Thus to the sons of Aaron they gave Hebron with its common-land (a city of refuge for the slayer), Libna with its common-land,

verses.text: Jattir with its common-land, Eshtemoa with its common-land,
parts: Jattir with its common-land, Eshtemoa with its common-land,

verses.text: Holon with its common-land, Debir with its common-land,
parts: Holon with its common-land, Debir with its common-land,

verses.text: Ain with its common-land, Juttah with its common-land, and Beth Shemesh with its common-land: nine cities from those two tribes;
parts: Ain with its common-land, Juttah with its common-land, and Beth Shemesh with its common-land: nine cities from those two tribes;

verses.text: and from the tribe of Benjamin: Gibeon with its common-land, Geba with its common-land,
parts: and from the tribe of Benjamin: Gibeon with its common-land, Geba with its common-land,

verses.text: Anathoth with its common-land, and Almon with its common-land: four cities.
parts: Anathoth with its common-land, and Almon with its common-land: four cities.

verses.text: All the cities of the sons of Aaron, the priests, were thirteen cities with their common-lands.
parts: All the cities of the sons of Aaron, the priests, were thirteen cities with their common-lands.

verses.text: Now the families of the sons of Kohath, the Levites, the rest of the sons of Kohath, had cities of their lot from the tribe of Ephraim.

parts: All the cities of the Levites within the possession of the sons of Israel were forty-eight cities with their common-lands.

verses.text: Every one of these cities had its common-land surrounding it; thus were all these cities.
parts: Every one of these cities had its common-land surrounding it; thus were all these cities.

verses.text: So Joshua finished dividing the land according to their borders,
parts: So Joshua finished dividing the land according to their borders,

verses.text: and the children of Israel gave a portion to Joshua according to the Lord's command.
parts: and the children of Israel gave a portion to Joshua according to the Lord's command.

verses.text: and Joshua built the city and dwelt in it.
parts: and Joshua built the city and dwelt in it.

verses.text: Then Joshua took the stone knives with which he circumcised the sons of Israel who were born on the way in the desert, and he put them in Timnath Serah.
parts: Then Joshua took the stone knives with which he circumcised the sons of Israel who were born on the way in the desert, and he put them in Timnath Serah.

verses.text: So the Lord gave Israel all the land He had sworn to give to their fathers; and they took possession of it and dwelt in it.
parts: So the Lord gave Israel all the land He had sworn to give to their fathers; and they took possession of it and dwelt in it.

verses.text: The Lord gave them rest all around, as He had sworn to their fathers, and no one rose up against them from all their enemies.
parts: The Lord gave them rest all around, as He had sworn to their fathers, and no one rose up against them from all their enemies.

verses.text: Not a word failed of any good thing the Lord had spoken to the children of Israel.
parts: Not a word failed of any good thing the Lord had spoken to the children of Israel.

verses.text: Then Joshua called together the children of Reuben, the children of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, and said to them, “You heard everything the servant of the Lord Moses commanded you, and have obeyed my voice in everything I commanded you.
parts: Then Joshua called together the children of Reuben, the children of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh,
and said to them, “You heard everything the servant of the Lord Moses commanded you, and have obeyed my voice in everything I commanded you.

verses.text: You have not left your brethren these many days, for until this day you have kept the commandment of the Lord your God.
parts: You have not left your brethren these many days, for until this day you have kept the commandment of the Lord your God.

verses.text: Now then, the Lord our God gave our brethren rest, as he said to them; now therefore, return and depart to your homes and to the land of your inheritance, which Moses gave you beyond the Jordan.
parts: Now then, the Lord our God gave our brethren rest, as he said to them; now therefore, return and depart to your homes and to the land of your inheritance, which Moses gave you beyond the Jordan.

verses.text: But be very careful to do the commandments and the law which Moses the servant of the Lord commanded you to do, to love the Lord your God, to walk in all His ways, to keep His commandments, to adhere to Him, and to serve Him with all your mind and with all your soul.”
parts: But be very careful to do the commandments and the law which Moses the servant of the Lord commanded you to do, to love the Lord your God, to walk in all His ways, to keep His commandments, to adhere to Him, and to serve Him with all your mind and with all your soul.”

verses.text: So Joshua blessed them and sent them forth; and they went to their homes.
parts: So Joshua blessed them and sent them forth; and they went to their homes.

verses.text: Now to the half-tribe of Manasseh Moses gave a possession in Bashan, and to the other half, Joshua gave a possession among his brethren on the other side of the Jordan toward the sea.
parts: Now to the half-tribe of Manasseh Moses gave a possession in Bashan, and to the other half, Joshua gave a possession among his brethren on the other side of the Jordan toward the sea.

verses.text: and they departed with much wealth to their homes, and with a great quantity of cattle, silver, gold, and iron, and with a great quantity of clothing; and they divided the spoils of the enemy with their brethren.
parts: and they departed with much wealth to their homes, and with a great quantity of cattle, silver, gold, and iron, and with a great quantity of clothing; and they divided the spoils of the enemy with their brethren.

verses.text: So the children of Reuben, the children of Gad, and the half-tribe of the children of Manasseh went forth from the children of Israel at Shiloh in the land of Canaan to go to the land of Gilead, to the land of their possession, which they obtained through the ordinance of the Lord by the hand of Moses.
parts: So the children of Reuben, the children of Gad, and the half-tribe of the children of Manasseh went forth from the children of Israel at Shiloh in the land of Canaan to go to the land of Gilead, to the land of their possession, which they obtained through the ordinance of the Lord by the hand of Moses.

verses.text: Then they came to Gilgal at the Jordan, which is in the land of Canaan, and the children of Gad, the children of Reuben, and the half-tribe of Manasseh built an altar there by the Jordan, an altar great to see. Now the children of Israel heard them saying, “Behold, the children of Gad, the children of Reuben, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have built an altar at the borders of the land of Canaan, at Gilead by the Jordan, on the opposite side of the children of Israel.” So all the children of Israel gathered together at Shiloh to go up to war against them.
parts: Then they came to Gilgal at the Jordan, which is in the land of Canaan, and the children of Gad, the children of Reuben, and the half-tribe of Manasseh built an altar there by the Jordan, an altar great to see.

Now the children of Israel heard them saying, “Behold, the children of Gad, the children of Reuben, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have built an altar at the borders of the land of Canaan, at Gilead by the Jordan, on the opposite side of the children of Israel.” So all the children of Israel gathered together at Shiloh to go up to war against them.

verses.text: Then the children of Israel sent Phinehas the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the high priest, to the children of Reuben, the children of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in the land of Gilead, and ten rulers with him, one ruler each from the paternal house of all the tribes of Israel; and they were the rulers of the paternal houses, the heads of a thousand, of Israel.
parts: Then the children of Israel sent Phinehas the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the high priest, to the children of Reuben, the children of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in the land of Gilead, and ten rulers with him, one ruler each from the paternal house of all the tribes of Israel; and they were the rulers of the paternal houses, the heads of a thousand, of Israel.

verses.text: and ten rulers with him, one ruler each from the paternal house of all the tribes of Israel; and they were the rulers of the paternal houses, the heads of a thousand, of Israel.
parts: and ten rulers with him, one ruler each from the paternal house of all the tribes of Israel; and they were the rulers of the paternal houses, the heads of a thousand, of Israel.

verses.text: They came to the children of Gad, the children of Reuben, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in the land of Gilead and spoke to them, saying,
parts: They came to the children of Gad, the children of Reuben, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in the land of Gilead and spoke to them, saying,

verses.text: “Thus says the whole congregation of the Lord, ‘What trespass have you committed against the God of Israel, turning away this day from the Lord, building an altar for yourselves, and becoming rebels against the Lord?
parts: “Thus says the whole congregation of the Lord, ‘What trespass have you committed against the God of Israel, turning away this day from the Lord, building an altar for yourselves, and becoming rebels against the Lord?

verses.text: Is Peor's sin too little for you?
parts: Is Peor's sin too little for you?

verses.text: Will you turn away from the Lord today?
parts: Will you turn away from the Lord today?

verses.text: Now if the land of your possession is too small for you, cross over to the land of the Lord's possession, where the tabernacle of the Lord dwells, and take possession among us; but do not become rebels against God, and do not rebel against the Lord by building yourselves an altar besides the altar of the Lord our God.
parts: Now if the land of your possession is too small for you, cross over to the land of the Lord's possession, where the tabernacle of the Lord dwells, and take possession among us; but do not become rebels against God, and do not rebel against the Lord by building yourselves an altar besides the altar of the Lord our God.

verses.text: Behold, did not Achan the son of Zerah commit a trespass in regard to the accursed thing, and bring wrath upon all the congregation of Israel?
parts: Behold, did not Achan the son of Zerah commit a trespass in regard to the accursed thing, and bring wrath upon all the congregation of Israel?

verses.text: Then the children of Reuben, the children of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh answered and spoke to the captains of the thousands of Israel, saying, “God, even God is the Lord, and God, even God the Lord Himself knows, and Israel himself shall know, that if we transgressed against the Lord in rebellion, may He not deliver us in this.
parts: Then the children of Reuben, the children of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh answered and spoke to the captains of the thousands of Israel, saying, “God, even God is the Lord, and God, even God the Lord Himself knows, and Israel himself shall know, that if we transgressed against the Lord in rebellion, may He not deliver us in this.

verses.text: “God, even God is the Lord, and God, even God the Lord Himself knows, and Israel himself shall know, that if we transgressed against the Lord in rebellion, may He not deliver us in this.
parts: “God, even God is the Lord, and God, even God the Lord Himself knows, and Israel himself shall know, that if we transgressed against the Lord in rebellion, may He not deliver us in this.

verses.text: If we have built ourselves an altar so as to depart from the Lord our God, and to offer upon it a sacrifice of whole burnt offerings, or a sacrifice of peace offering, then the Lord will require it.
parts: If we have built ourselves an altar so as to depart from the Lord our God, and to offer upon it a sacrifice of whole burnt offerings, or a sacrifice of peace offering, then the Lord will require it.

verses.text: But we have done this thing as a matter of reverence, saying, ‘Lest hereafter your children may say to our children, “What have you to do with the Lord God of Israel?
parts: But we have done this thing as a matter of reverence, saying, ‘Lest hereafter your children may say to our children, “What have you to do with the Lord God of Israel?

verses.text: The Lord made the Jordan a border between us and you, and there is no portion of the Lord for you.” Thus your sons shall alienate our sons, so they should not worship the Lord.’
parts: The Lord made the Jordan a border between us and you, and there is no portion of the Lord for you.” Thus your sons shall alienate our sons, so they should not worship the Lord.’

verses.text: So we told them to build this altar, not for burnt offerings or sacrifices,
parts: So we told them to build this altar, not for burnt offerings or sacrifices,

verses.text: but as a witness between us and you, and between our generations after us, that we do service to the Lord before Him with our burnt offerings and sacrifices, and with our peace offerings; so your children shall not say to our children hereafter, ‘There is no portion of the Lord for you.’
parts: but as a witness between us and you, and between our generations after us, that we do service to the Lord before Him with our burnt offerings and sacrifices, and with our peace offerings; so your children shall not say to our children hereafter, ‘There is no portion of the Lord for you.’

verses.text: Therefore we said, ‘If ever it shall come to pass that they should speak to us and to our generations hereafter, they shall say, “Come and see the likeness of the Lord's altar which our fathers made, not for the sake of burnt offerings or for sacrifices, but as a witness between us and you, and between our children.”
parts: Therefore we said, ‘If ever it shall come to pass that they should speak to us and to our generations hereafter, they shall say, “Come and see the likeness of the Lord's altar which our fathers made, not for the sake of burnt offerings or for sacrifices, but as a witness between us and you, and between our children.”

verses.text: May we not therefore turn away from the Lord in these days and revolt from the Lord, to build ourselves an altar for burnt offerings, for peace offerings, and for the sacrifice of peace, besides the altar of the Lord, which is before His tabernacle.’ ”
parts: May we not therefore turn away from the Lord in these days and revolt from the Lord, to build ourselves an altar for burnt offerings, for peace offerings, and for the sacrifice of peace, besides the altar of the Lord, which is before His tabernacle.’ ”

verses.text: Now when Phinehas the priest and all the rulers of the congregation of Israel who were with him heard the words spoken by the children of Reuben, the children of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, it pleased them. Then Phinehas the priest said to the children of Reuben, the children of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, “Today we know that the Lord is with us, because you have not transgressed grievously against the Lord, and because you have delivered the children of Israel out of the Lord's hand.” After this, Phinehas the priest and the rulers returned from the children of Reuben, the children of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, from the land of Gilead to the land of Canaan, to the children of Israel, and reported to them these words; and it pleased the children of Israel.
parts: Now when Phinehas the priest and all the rulers of the congregation of Israel who were with him heard the words spoken by the children of Reuben, the children of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, it pleased them.

Then Phinehas the priest said to the children of Reuben, the children of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, “Today we know that the Lord is with us, because you have not transgressed grievously against the Lord, and because you have delivered the children of Israel out of the Lord's hand.” After this, Phinehas the priest and the rulers returned from the children of Reuben, the children of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, from the land of Gilead to the land of Canaan, to the children of Israel, and reported to them these words; and it pleased the children of Israel.

parts: Then Phinehas the priest said to the children of Reuben, the children of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, “Today we know that the Lord is with us, because you have not transgressed grievously against the Lord, and because you have delivered the children of Israel out of the Lord's hand.”

verses.text: After this, Phinehas the priest and the rulers returned from the children of Reuben, the children of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, from the land of Gilead to the land of Canaan, to the children of Israel, and reported to them these words;
parts: After this, Phinehas the priest and the rulers returned from the children of Reuben, the children of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, from the land of Gilead to the land of Canaan, to the children of Israel, and reported to them these words;

verses.text: and it pleased the children of Israel.
parts: and it pleased the children of Israel.

verses.text: Then Joshua named the altar of the children of Reuben, of Gad, and of the half-tribe of Manasseh, and said that it is a witness in their midst, that the Lord is their God.
parts: Then Joshua named the altar of the children of Reuben, of Gad, and of the half-tribe of Manasseh, and said that it is a witness in their midst, that the Lord is their God.

verses.text: Now it came to pass that after many days, the Lord gave rest to Israel from all their enemies round about, and Joshua was old and advanced in years. So Joshua summoned all the children of Israel and their elders and leaders and their scribes and judges, and said to them, “I am old and advanced in years, and you have seen everything the Lord your God did to all these nations before you, that the Lord your God is He who fought for you.
parts: Now it came to pass that after many days, the Lord gave rest to Israel from all their enemies round about, and Joshua was old and advanced in years.

So Joshua summoned all the children of Israel and their elders and leaders and their scribes and judges, and said to them, “I am old and advanced in years, and you have seen everything the Lord your God did to all these nations before you, that the Lord your God is He who fought for you.

verses.text: See, I have added to you these nations that are left to you by lots to your tribes, beginning at the Jordan and bordered by the Great Sea westward, all the nations I utterly destroyed before you.
parts: See, I have added to you these nations that are left to you by lots to your tribes, beginning at the Jordan and bordered by the Great Sea westward, all the nations I utterly destroyed before you.

verses.text: For the Lord your God, He will utterly destroy them before you until they perish, and He will send wild animals against them until He utterly destroys them and their kings from before you; and you shall inherit their land as the Lord your God said to you.
parts: For the Lord your God, He will utterly destroy them before you until they perish, and He will send wild animals against them until He utterly destroys them and their kings from before you; and you shall inherit their land as the Lord your God said to you.

verses.text: Therefore strive diligently to keep and to do everything written in the Book of the Law of Moses, lest you turn aside from it to the right or to the left,
parts: Therefore strive diligently to keep and to do everything written in the Book of the Law of Moses, lest you turn aside from it to the right or to the left,

verses.text: and lest you go among these nations, those that remain among you.
parts: and lest you go among these nations, those that remain among you.

verses.text: but you shall cleave to the Lord your God, as you have done to this day.
parts: but you shall cleave to the Lord your God, as you have done to this day.

verses.text: For the Lord has utterly destroyed them before you, great and mighty nations, and no one has stood against you to this day.
parts: For the Lord has utterly destroyed them before you, great and mighty nations, and no one has stood against you to this day.

verses.text: One of you has chased a thousand, for the Lord your God fought for you, as He said to you.
parts: One of you has chased a thousand, for the Lord your God fought for you, as He said to you.

verses.text: Therefore take great heed to love the Lord your God.
parts: Therefore take great heed to love the Lord your God.

verses.text: For if you turn away and attach yourselves to the remnant of these nations among you, and intermarry and become mingled with them and they with you,
parts: For if you turn away and attach yourselves to the remnant of these nations among you, and intermarry and become mingled with them and they with you,

verses.text: know for certain that the Lord will no longer utterly destroy these nations before you; but they shall be snares and traps for you, and nails in your heels and darts in your eyes, until you perish from this good land which the Lord your God has given you.
parts: know for certain that the Lord will no longer utterly destroy these nations before you; but they shall be snares and traps for you, and nails in your heels and darts in your eyes, until you perish from this good land which the Lord your God has given you.

verses.text: “But I am going the way of all those on earth, and you shall know in your heart and soul that not one word has failed of all the words the Lord our God spoke concerning everything that pertains to you.
parts: “But I am going the way of all those on earth, and you shall know in your heart and soul that not one word has failed of all the words the Lord our God spoke concerning everything that pertains to you.

verses.text: Therefore it shall come to pass that as all the good things came upon you which the Lord promised you, so the Lord God will bring upon you all the evil things, until He utterly destroys you from this good land which the Lord has given you,
parts: Therefore it shall come to pass that as all the good things came upon you which the Lord promised you, so the Lord God will bring upon you all the evil things, until He utterly destroys you from this good land which the Lord has given you,

verses.text: when you transgress the covenant of the Lord your God which He commanded you, and go and serve other gods, and worship them.”
parts: when you transgress the covenant of the Lord your God which He commanded you, and go and serve other gods, and worship them.”

verses.text: Then Joshua gathered together all the tribes of Israel to Shiloh, and summoned their elders, scribes, and judges; and he set them before God. Then Joshua said to all the people, “Thus says the Lord God of Israel, ‘From the beginning your fathers dwelt on the other side of the river, including Terah the father of Abraham and the father of Nahor, and they served other gods.
parts: Then Joshua gathered together all the tribes of Israel to Shiloh, and summoned their elders, scribes, and judges; and he set them before God.

Then Joshua said to all the people, “Thus says the Lord God of Israel, ‘From the beginning your fathers dwelt on the other side of the river, including Terah the father of Abraham and the father of Nahor, and they served other gods.

verses.text: But I took your father Abraham from the other side of the river, led him into all the land, multiplied his seed, and gave him Isaac,
parts: But I took your father Abraham from the other side of the river, led him into all the land, multiplied his seed, and gave him Isaac,

verses.text: and to Isaac, Jacob and Esau.
parts: and to Isaac, Jacob and Esau.

verses.text: But the Egyptians maltreated them, so the Lord smote Egypt for what it did to them.
parts: But the Egyptians maltreated them, so the Lord smote Egypt for what it did to them.

verses.text: After that, you came out of Egypt to the Red Sea, and the Egyptians pursued your fathers with chariots and horses to the Red Sea.
parts: After that, you came out of Egypt to the Red Sea, and the Egyptians pursued your fathers with chariots and horses to the Red Sea.

verses.text: So we cried out to the Lord, and He placed a cloud and darkness between us and the Egyptians.
parts: So we cried out to the Lord, and He placed a cloud and darkness between us and the Egyptians.

verses.text: Then He brought you into the land of the Amorites, who dwelt on the other side of the Jordan, and they fought with you; but the Lord gave them over into your hands that you might take possession of their land, and He utterly destroyed them from before you.
parts: Then He brought you into the land of the Amorites, who dwelt on the other side of the Jordan, and they fought with you; but the Lord gave them over into your hands that you might take possession of their land, and He utterly destroyed them from before you.

verses.text: Then Balak the son of Zippor, the king of Moab, arose to make war against Israel, and he sent and called Balaam to lay a curse on you.
parts: Then Balak the son of Zippor, the king of Moab, arose to make war against Israel, and he sent and called Balaam to lay a curse on you.

verses.text: But the Lord your God would not destroy you, and greatly blessed you.
parts: But the Lord your God would not destroy you, and greatly blessed you.

verses.text: Then you crossed the Jordan and came to Jericho.
parts: Then you crossed the Jordan and came to Jericho.

verses.text: He sent hornets before you and drove them out from before you, the twelve kings of the Amorites, but not with your sword or with your bow.
parts: He sent hornets before you and drove them out from before you, the twelve kings of the Amorites, but not with your sword or with your bow.

verses.text: He gave you a land for which you did not labor, and cities you did not build; and you dwelt in them.
parts: He gave you a land for which you did not labor, and cities you did not build; and you dwelt in them.

verses.text: “Now therefore, fear the Lord, and serve Him in justice and righteousness.
parts: “Now therefore, fear the Lord, and serve Him in justice and righteousness.

verses.text: But if it does not please you to serve the Lord, choose gods for yourselves today whom you will serve, whether the gods of your fathers that were on the other side of the river, or the gods of the Amorites, among whom you dwell in their land.
parts: But if it does not please you to serve the Lord, choose gods for yourselves today whom you will serve, whether the gods of your fathers that were on the other side of the river, or the gods of the Amorites, among whom you dwell in their land.

verses.text: Then the people answered and said, “Far be it from us to forsake the Lord, so as to serve other gods. The Lord our God, He is God.
parts: Then the people answered and said, “Far be it from us to forsake the Lord, so as to serve other gods.
The Lord our God, He is God.

verses.text: The Lord our God, He is God.
parts: The Lord our God, He is God.

verses.text: The Lord cast out before us the Amorite and all the nations that inhabited the land.
parts: The Lord cast out before us the Amorite and all the nations that inhabited the land.

verses.text: But Joshua said to the people, “You cannot serve the Lord, for He is a holy God, and He being jealous will not forgive your sins and your lawless deeds.
parts: But Joshua said to the people, “You cannot serve the Lord, for He is a holy God, and He being jealous will not forgive your sins and your lawless deeds.

verses.text: Whenever you forsake the Lord and serve other gods, then He shall come and deal harshly with you and will consume you, after He has done you good.”
parts: Whenever you forsake the Lord and serve other gods, then He shall come and deal harshly with you and will consume you, after He has done you good.”

verses.text: Then the people said to Joshua, “No, but we will serve the Lord.”
parts: Then the people said to Joshua, “No, but we will serve the Lord.”

verses.text: So Joshua said to the people, “You are witnesses against yourselves that you have chosen to serve the Lord.
parts: So Joshua said to the people, “You are witnesses against yourselves that you have chosen to serve the Lord.

verses.text: Now therefore, remove the foreign gods from among you and make your heart straight toward the Lord God of Israel.”
parts: Now therefore, remove the foreign gods from among you and make your heart straight toward the Lord God of Israel.”

verses.text: Again the people said to Joshua, “We will serve the Lord, and obey His voice.”
parts: Again the people said to Joshua, “We will serve the Lord, and obey His voice.”

verses.text: So Joshua established a covenant with the people on that day, and gave them a law and judgment in Shiloh before the tabernacle of the God of Israel. Then he wrote these words in the Book of the Law of God; and he took a large stone and set it up under the terebinth tree before the Lord.
parts: So Joshua established a covenant with the people on that day, and gave them a law and judgment in Shiloh before the tabernacle of the God of Israel.
Then he wrote these words in the Book of the Law of God; and he took a large stone and set it up under the terebinth tree before the Lord.

verses.text: Then he wrote these words in the Book of the Law of God; and he took a large stone and set it up under the terebinth tree before the Lord.
parts: Then he wrote these words in the Book of the Law of God; and he took a large stone and set it up under the terebinth tree before the Lord.

verses.text: After this, Joshua said to the people, “Behold, this stone shall be a witness among you, because it has heard everything said to it by the Lord, whatever He spoke to us today.
parts: After this, Joshua said to the people, “Behold, this stone shall be a witness among you, because it has heard everything said to it by the Lord, whatever He spoke to us today.

verses.text: So Joshua sent the people away, and they went forth, each one to his place.
parts: So Joshua sent the people away, and they went forth, each one to his place.

verses.text: Then Israel served the Lord all the days of Joshua and all the days of the elders, as many as were with Joshua and saw all the works of the Lord which he did for Israel.
parts: Then Israel served the Lord all the days of Joshua and all the days of the elders, as many as were with Joshua and saw all the works of the Lord which he did for Israel.

verses.text: Now it came to pass after these things that Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of the Lord, died at the age of one hundred and ten years.
parts: Now it came to pass after these things that Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of the Lord, died at the age of one hundred and ten years.

verses.text: They buried him within the boundary lines of his inheritance at Timnath Serah, on Mount Ephraim on the north side of Mount Gaash.
parts: They buried him within the boundary lines of his inheritance at Timnath Serah, on Mount Ephraim on the north side of Mount Gaash.

verses.text: In his grave they placed with him the stone knives with which he circumcised the sons of Israel at Gilgal, when he brought them out of Egypt, as the Lord ordered them.
parts: In his grave they placed with him the stone knives with which he circumcised the sons of Israel at Gilgal, when he brought them out of Egypt, as the Lord ordered them.

verses.text: The children of Israel also brought up the bones of Joseph from Egypt and buried them at Shechem, in the plot of land which Jacob purchased from the Amorites who dwelled in Shechem for one hundred lambs, and which was given to Joseph as his portion.
parts: The children of Israel also brought up the bones of Joseph from Egypt and buried them at Shechem, in the plot of land which Jacob purchased from the Amorites who dwelled in Shechem for one hundred lambs, and which was given to Joseph as his portion.

verses.text: After this, Eleazar the son of Aaron the high priest died and was buried in Gabaath, which belonged to Phinehas his son, and which he had given him on Mount Ephraim.
parts: After this, Eleazar the son of Aaron the high priest died and was buried in Gabaath, which belonged to Phinehas his son, and which he had given him on Mount Ephraim.

verses.text: On that day the children of Israel took the ark of God and carried it about among themselves, and Phinehas held the office of priest in place of Eleazar his father, until he died and was buried in his own place at Gabaath.
parts: On that day the children of Israel took the ark of God and carried it about among themselves, and Phinehas held the office of priest in place of Eleazar his father, until he died and was buried in his own place at Gabaath.

verses.text: But each of the children of Israel departed to his own place and to his own city.
parts: But each of the children of Israel departed to his own place and to his own city.
